Title: Powerful little fan.
Review Content: This is the 2nd time I’ve purchased this fan. First one lasted probably over 10 years before it finally wore out. Has great air flow and runs quietly. It’s small and doesn’t take up much space. I use it in the bathroom while I’m drying my hair and getting dressed. Also take it with us when we travel because I like a fan blowing over me while I sleep. And I like the white noise.

Title: BUY IT!! YOU WON’T REGRET IT!!
Review Content: Best desk top fan ever!! Stronger than a large stand up fan!
Manually Corrected Title: BUY IT!! YOU WON’T REGRET IT!!
Manually Corrected Review Content: Best desk top fan ever!! Stronger than a large stand up fan!

Title: works well for its size
Review Content: What makes this fan perfect for me is that it is small and narrow.  I have a tiny kitchen with very little counter space and this fan fits perfect between my sink and microwave.  I wouldn't say it's crazy powerful, but it definitely moves the air enough to make a difference.  For as much as this fan is great though, it doesn't seem to last.  I have had to buy a new one every year because it starts making this grinding noise when oscillating after a while.  So the cost definitely adds up for me.  Still.  I can't argue with it's size and function and haven't been able to find anything that works remotely as well that is this small.

Title: Great so far! Updated: Still great!
Review Content: I come from the land of the ice and snow, but I share a thermostat with three lizard-people. I needed something to pull the hallway air into my area without causing them to be uncomfortable for my happiness.I set up this fan immediately when I got it, and was thrilled with it. I turned it on, high speed, and immediately appreciated the air flow. It's got a little bit of a high-pitched whirr in the sound of the fan, but I quit noticing it after a little while. I heard it more prominently in the hallway outside my office, but no one else commented on it, and again, I quit noticing.On that first day, when I stepped out of my office to run an errand, I pushed the power button - and found the low setting. It's significantly quieter, and still has noticeable air flow. The lower setting, on oscillate, has been perfect for most days. On occasion, I'll use the high setting when the weather outside shifts suddenly warmer and the HVAC isn't ready for that change.I like the oscillation on both settings - it moves slowly, which is nice. And the oscillation itself doesn't make any noise, which is nice.And all of that was _after_ I dropped it on the ground while juggling lots of things between my house and car, to head to work. So far so good. I picked up this fan after reading millions of reviews on _other_ fans. I bought this one because it's cheap and sounded similar, in positives and negatives, to so many others - if it's going to be horrible, at least I'm not out $50+ bucks.**UPDATE** 08-08-2017After consistent perfect performance, this afternoon the fan on low setting dramatically reduced power. It still oscillates and kicks out air, but only barely noticeable from arms length. The white noise aspect is greatly diminished. I haven't tried cleaning it yet - there was a good bit of dust on the air intake grate.  High power setting function, with and without oscillate, is still flawless.**UPDATE** 09-13-2017I think it objected to being turned off at the extension cord it shares with one lamp, as opposed to via the unit controls. When I started exclusively using the unit controls, it started working normally again. Weird, but that's easy to accommodate.**UPDATE** 01-09-2025This trusty workhorse has been a steady performer for years now. Today, it developed a screech that I'll have to investigate. If I can get it working nicely again, it'll be relocated to my house. Today, I bought a new one for daily use in the office.

Title: Loud Vibrating Noise
Review Content: Fan works well. Has only two speeds. But, just recently it has started to make a loud vibrating noise. Sounds like it is coming from the motor. Wish I could return to get a replacement, but the window has closed.  It is too loud for an office setting.
Manually Corrected Review Content: Fan works well. Has only two speeds. But, just recently it has started to make a loud vibrating noise. Sounds like it is coming from the motor. Wish I could return to get a replacement, but the window has closed.  It is too loud for an office setting.

Title: Unique design, perfect for the desk or cubicle.
Review Content: I love this fan it is the perfect size for a desk or cubicle. I work in a nice cubicle Monday to Friday 8am to 5pm and it's nice to have this fan when it gets a little warm. I want to say it is quiet, and it is, the fan is generally quiet. However, something is always rattling or making noises. I figured it is just part of the operation. I had 3 others in the office buy the same fan after they saw mine and they all make a slightly different noise, but they are still quiet and push a lot of air.Being that this fan is the 'blower' type or 'hamster wheel' type it really does push a lot of air. And you do not get the swirling effect that normal fan blades create, or the slicing of the air effect. This one feels good when it is blowing on you, but you may want to have it oscillate because if it is blowing on my face as I am working on the computer it makes my eyes very dry and I cannot have it blowing on me for too long. That's okay though because I don't think you should have any sort of fan blowing directly on you for an extended period of time.As you may already know it has 2 speeds, low and high. The high speed is too loud if you are on the phone around your co-workers. The low speed is the quiet setting and it still pushes plenty of air. I had to adjust it several times because my 'cold' neighbors could feel the breeze and didn't like it.I would recommend this fan. It pushes more air on your desk than any sort of desk style blade fan. They make those mini fans that look like smaller version of those floor standing fans, but this fan moves more air. I purchased it because I like the brand and I was also thoroughly impressed at the slim design and the use of an all metal blower fan. Oh yes, that's right, the blower is all metal!! The back of it is perforated metal. The air inlet is actually only a sliver of the back on the right side, You can see the plastic shell inside, that only allows it to suck air in through about an inch and a half strip in the back right if you are looking at it from the front. However, this is probably what creates it's strong air flow and high pressure (for it's size).

Title: It’s “quiet”…compared to a full sized box fan on high
Review Content: I had high hopes for this fan. My sister had purchased an older version of this fan and it was much quieter than this one. I have a 15” Vornado running in the next room over that is less than half the volume of this desktop fan. As a matter of fact, the Vornado runs so silently you have to actually be standing next to it to hear it (when running on low setting). The high setting on this desktop fan is quieter than the low setting, if you can believe it. I would imagine it would be much quieter if good bearings were used (rattles in both high and low modes) and if they ducted the fan properly (high-pitched sound the fan makes along with the rattling). Also, the buttons almost require two hands to press. They’re so cheap they require pressing harder than expected and with the fan weighing so little, pressing the switches moves the fan. Have to either grip the entire fan front to back or use one hand to steady the fan while pressing the buttons with the other. The buttons feel like they have reached the end of their life (you know, like you’ve pressed it so many times the “throw” of the switch or distance it pushes in is nearly nonexistent. It would have been better if they had used touch-sensitive switches since the fan is so lightweight.Manufacturer, spend a little more money on quality parts to build your product and raise the price a little to compensate but give us a product we don’t mind telling others about.So sad.

Title: One of the best mini tower fan...
Review Content: One of the best mini tower fan I ever had! My budget is tight but I figured better spend some money to help cool the back of computer or an Xbox console as it would obviously cost way more than I can afford if I don't help it cool down. I did quite a research before I bought 3 types of fans by reading the 3 star reviews of small/personal fans here at amazon.This one is a bit more than the spt mini tower fan but it was my first choice because generally, i have had good experience with lasko products (had a tower fan and i have a tower heater) and so I bought it along with the spt.I regret buying the spt for the lower price and just to satisfy my curiosity (benefit of a doubt that it's just a matter of marketing) because my unit is very noisy and at the same time tilts/leans when it oscillates. Now, I don't know if all spt mini towers are like that or if mine is an isolated case but that's basically a fact in my case. I can't return or exchange because it has been months since my purchase and I only tried the oscillate function today. Sigh:(Anyway, going back to this lasko mini tower fan, omg!!! It's sooooo quiet that I sometimes forget to turn it off!!! And the air flow is close to the brookstone mini max tower fan (this one is really good too!) that I've had for many years now.I have fixed the spt mini in a corner away from people and pets (when it leans to the right, it looks like it could literally fall - scary scenario for me) as a precaution. But what I'm going to do eventually, when I have extra money is that I'll buy another one of this lasko mini tower. It's so slim. Looks elegant like the brookstone. It's worth every penny!!!I wish they'd also make something a bit taller for kitchen to help dry dishes and also one that would stand horizontally to put on op of kitchen cabinets!!!

Title: Very loud clicking sound
Review Content: This fan sounds like it’s about to break down at any second. It’s like a clicking and grinding sound. I bought it because I had one identical to it for years and figured it would be the same. No. This one looks the same but sounds terrible and doesn’t run the same. The light is very bright so if you use it at night it will illuminate your room. I put bandaids over it to keep it dim.

Title: I really like this fan
Review Content: I really like this fan.  Though it is a smaller than I anticipated, it does a great job of providing the right amount of air flow needed. for the area.I also like that it is child friendly, meaning they would have to really try to hurt themselves with this product rather than the large blade fans.This review is my full and honest opinion after testing and examining all aspects of this product in my own home, for my own use.  My goal in reviewing products is to help others, like you, in their search for the best products on Amazon.  If I give the product a five star review, that means that I am extremely happy with the product. Five stars means that the product has gone beyond and above my expectations and I would have paid/will pay in the future the full price plus shipping for this product. I will definitely continue to purchase five star products for myself as well as recommend them to my friends and family. Four stars: If I give the product four stars, this means that I really like the product and I have found a good use for it. The product function as intended and serves it's purpose well. It is likely that I would purchase this product again in the future. Three stars: If I rate a product at three stars, that means that I am  satisfied with the product, but I do not believe it is the best in its product area, therefore I would definitely search for other products within that area the next time I purchase. Two Stars: If I give the product two stars, that means that i am not impressed. I would not purchase the product again. There maybe elements of the product that are not exactly defective, but are not desirable. One Star:  If I give  the product one star, I am unsatisfied with the product/does not work/it is defective. I would definitely not purchase this product again.

Title: Small, Stylish and works well
Review Content: I purchased two of these small tower fans, one for my office cubical at work and another for my desk at home.  After a week of use at work, I really like it.  It uses very little space so it doesn't get in the way.  Strong enough to provide enough air circulation to keep me cool.  Some of my office co-workers have even asked about it, they found it to be very stylish.  I would have given it five stars if it weren't for the very cheap plastic power on and oscillating buttons on the front.  They do require some pressure to switch on.  I think they could have made a fantastic small fan even better by moving the led light off the button itself and providing soft touch rubber buttons instead.  Time will tell if the hard plastic cheap buttons will last or break with time.  The other issue I had and its not a big deal, it isn't silent as I had hoped.  It does sound like a hair dryer on a low fan setting.  My office space at work is pretty quiet so perhaps I can hear it more than many others might.  In a busy office environment you might not even notice the sound.  Another suggestion I would recommend to Lasko would be if they could provide another version of this same fan with grip for mounting underneath office cabinets and shelves.  Given how small and slim this fan is, a grip that would allow for 180-degree swivel underneath a shelve or cabinet would be absolutely ideal for the office.  Anyway, I'm giving it four stars because I feel there is some room for improvement on this very nice design and hopefully some of my suggestions might be taken into consideration and show up in a updated model.

Title: GREAT PRODUCT
Review Content: Bought 2 of these in 2011.  One for the office and one next to my easy chair, both get used everyday.  The one in the office finally quit (bearing failure) but the other one is still going!  I ordered 2 more because I am anticipating the other 13 yr old to give out sometime.

Title: Slim and perfect for an office desk.
Review Content: I purchased this as a gift to myself from a GC I got for my birthday. I have really been wanting and needing a small fan for my desk at work and after going over many brands/styles/reviews I decided upon this one. What I found is that while not completely silent this fan is just as quiet or even more so than any of my co-workers fans. I really enjoy that it oscillates and has two speeds. Most often I just use the low speed for some air movement but it's nice to have the choice when it's hotter and I want it to blow harder. It blows a good distance and I can place it at the furthest point away from me on my desk (3-4 feet) and still feel it blowing on me with either setting. The only thing I don't like is the power button. You have to press it very hard to turn it off, and when you do it physically moves the entire fan and risks knocking it over. I found the best practice is to hold onto the base when I want to press the button. I just wish I didn't have to hold it, turning it on the button does not need pressed as hard. Also I feel like if I'm not careful I risk breaking the oscillation if I grab the upper part of the fan that is moving. Regardless of the button, I would purchase this again for small fans on side/night tables around my home.

Title: Good desk fan
Review Content: This desk fan works good. It keeps me cool when I'm gaming. The only bad side is that it makes noise when running.
Manually Corrected Review Content: This desk fan works good. It keeps me cool when I'm gaming. The only bad side is that it makes noise when running.

Title: Makes horribly loud noise.
Review Content: I will say that this little fan does a great job of moving air. But that is the only thing it has going for it.This little monster makes a horribly distracting sound. I got it for my nightstand to help keep just me cool at night, but this thing is so loud it drowned out my white noise machine only with a very unpleasant sound. The other issue I have with it, and with most modern electronics, is that it uses those obnoxious bright blue LEDs to backlight the buttons. I ended up moving it to my home office, but the noise it makes is distracting. It does help keep the room cooler so I will keep it but I wouldn't buy another one or suggest it to anyone.

Title: Not for bedroom, too loud and cannot turn off light
Review Content: We used to have one of these in the bathroom and we liked it there, compact, blows okay, buzzy fan is great to mask other noises. Few years later we thought we’d order another one since we needed a little airflow in the bedroom while sleeping, not good for that. Forgot how loud this thing is. Also, the bright blue led light for the power and rotate button never turns off. Too bright for bedroom.

Title: Would give this fan 5/5 stars, but...
Review Content: UPDATE: Earlier today, 2/5/18, I wrote the below review and gave this product 2/5 stars. Since then, I took the fan apart and found that one of the two screw-in brackets that holds the motor to the oscillating unit (fan blades) was loose. This bracket also keeps the fan blades in place rather than moving around freely while spinning. I tightened these down and the fan is now working as good as when it was brand new, possibly even more quietly. I'm very happy that it wasn't anything more serious like a bearing in the motor actually having failed so early on. I'm giving this product 4/5 stars because I shouldn't have had to fix this fan so early on. Otherwise, this fan would receive a 5/5 for its small footprint, quiet nature, and for serving its purpose well, which is to be a desk fan at my office.Great fan for the first 2 months. Now it's screaming loudly. I don't know if there's something that is rubbing up against the frame inside or if it's a bearing that is loose, it's not a knocking sound. But, in any case, I'm very disappointed in this. I'd be happy if someone would contact me about getting a replacement, I would be more than willing to send my current one back if anyone wants to inspect it. I did really like the fan when it worked.

Title: Lasko
Review Content: The light is very bright in a dark room so I had to cover it while using the fan. On the higher speed, it can be very noisy.
Manually Corrected Review Content: The light is very bright in a dark room so I had to cover it while using the fan. On the higher speed, it can be very noisy.

Title: Died doing what it did best
Review Content: Bought this cheap little unit for a very unpleasant task: it sat in a hot-box with a big steam radiator, blowing the hot air into the rest of the apartment.The radiator was big enough, but the hot air just sat in the middle of the living room. So I built a box around it like an outdoor grill, with an intake opening close to the floor and the output at the top of the other side, over the radiator. It helped, but it needed help. Enter the really cheap fan.First two, including a little Vornado, really didn't work, and hated the heat. So I Amazoned my way to this thing, as it was cheap and fit the strange little space I had for it. I intended to put it on a timer to go on and off with the heat, but the electronic switch wasn't compatible.So I left it on. Less than a year later, a mere eight thousand hours of continuous use at temps over 100°, it started squeaking. High pitched baby mouse stuck in a glue trap sort of squeak. I don't like it. WD-40 won't fix it. It's dead.But it was only thirty bucks, and it worked for almost a year without stopping. I am getting another one, assuming fan technology at this price point hasn't made some sort of massive lurch forward. And I'm buying a better timer.

Title: Always buy Lasko
Review Content: I have another Lasko fan that has been running non stop in my room for 7 years, all day, every day. These aren't cheap throw away fans, you will likely pass these down for 17 generations with your grandmother's fine china and your fathers watch. I don't do other brands, it's Lasko for me

Title: Functional and Attractive Desk Fan
Review Content: This fan does indeed have two settings, they should probably be named 'Very Low' and 'Even Lower'.  It is small and looks nice on a desk but if what you need is something to move air around (rather than a desk ornament) I would recommend a different product, this one just does not have enough strength.Edit: I have now used this fan for several years. As a desk fan, it is very nice. I probably would not want it to be any stronger than it is, and I regularly use the low setting, which I called 'Even Lower' in my original review. When the fan is on a desk, and therefore close to your face, you do not want the air current very strong.I have now ordered three of these, and they are a regular fixture on my desk at any new job.  The build quality is pretty good: the first one went out on me completely after about three years of daily use, and this newest one (my third) makes more noise on the high setting than the other two - it has a slight rattle, which is not too bad. Overall, this is a functional desk fan that looks quite nice next to my monitor.  I would certainly choose this fan over any of the others I have tried in this price range.

Title: Perfect for a warm office space!
Review Content: I purchased this fan because my little ol' desk fan was just not cutting it anymore. My office space is the only one here that blows warm air year round, no matter how many times I put in a work order for the air conditioner. It is begining to warm up in NYC and I just had to find something that would keep me cool and wouldn't take up much space. I found this product and ordered it right away.It is large enough to fit on my desk as well as sit on the floor and produce the same outcome. The swivel feature is great for air circulation. The High and low settings are also great. After some time, I become cold (With a blazer on and the warm air still blowing in my office and all), so I turn it on low and let it still circulate air. The machine is very quiet to me, but then agian, I also have the central air blowing overhead so I cannot tell and cannot review the sound part. The design is very sleek and looks great in a professional setting.Attached are photos of the machine and it's size next to a regular water bottle. Also is a sticky note being blown on LOW setting so you can till see the power it has. I reccomend purchasing this product. Let's see how it holds up when NYC hits the high 90's this summer! Wish me luck!

Title: Perfect Office Desk Fan
Review Content: For 2 years I have worked in an office where war has been fought over the ambient temperature.  Some like it cool and some like it very hot.  I am a "like it cool" dude.Now that spring is here, the war is back on this soldier is sick of fighting.  I decided to buy a fan, but (darn) which one?  It seems there are millions out there.  After reading reviews, I decided to purchase this fan.It arrived and I was initially put-off by its small size.  Don't let the small size fool you.  This fan, on the slow speed, moves ample air and is whisper quiet.  It does the job and does it well.  Now I am not as warm and am uber content not being caught up in the temperature battles.I do not recommend this Lasko if you sleep with a fan at night.  It has 2 speeds and is too quiet at the lowest speed to provide the "white noise" that us urban dwellers around the world have come to rely on.Overall, 2 thumbs up, way up, on this fan as an office companionPros:1) QUIET2) Moves ample air3) Small and takes up little desk-top real estate4) Attractive5) OscillatesCons:1) Not loud enough to sleep with (only a con if you want night noise)

Title: Acts as a mechanical air conditioner!
Review Content: The Lasko 4000 Air Stik has kept me cool all summer! It's a personal table fan that normally sits on a small table in my family room, 3.5 feet away from where I sit to watch TV. I run it on high and have it directly on me; oscillation mode not used.The output is not as powerful as an equivalent circular table fan. I would give it five stars if the high mode was powerful enough to give me a reason to use the oscillation mode. One advantage it has over a table fan, the temperature of the exiting air feels cooler. I attribute it to the air traveling through the metal funnel inside the unit. Metal is a good conductor of heat so the fan is actually conditioning the air.A few times over the summer I have taken the fan with me to a couple of indoor air-soft fields located in warehouses. The staging areas lack air conditioning so I have this fan sitting two feet away on the picnic bench. I own a Blizzard circular table fan that I could take instead, but this fan fits in my gear box better and the exiting air has never failed to cool me down!The fan is a bargain at Amazons price and I would purchase another one, even one every summer if needed.

Title: Everything I expected !!
Review Content: Oh My Lord, I am in heaven. This little machine puts out great air flow. I have always been a fan, (no pun intended) of LASKO fans. They have always been reliable for me. So when I saw this mini tower fan, I was excited to replace the little fan on my desk. I have to have air moving around me, I can't breathe or work well in warm environments. My office building has it's hot and cold spots, and I just happen to be in the hot stuffy area. So I have always had a desk fan and a floor fan going. First thing this morning , I unpacked and plugged in this fan on my desk and hit on. The default setting is on high and I don't think it is too loud at all. Maybe it is because the floor fan that was always on, was very loud and I guess I came to live with that. I don't have the floor fan on right now and I don't know that I will need it . I work in a busy office and prefer to drown out some of the background noise. But this unit is not loud like that. It doesn't drown out anything. It is on oscillate right now and it feels very cool.  So headphones on, a hot cup of coffee and my cool work space......I am almost too happy to be at work~

Title: Annoying Whine + Pressure Controls
Review Content: I have 2 of these, purchased during 2019, based on an older fan of the same model.  One is in my home office, one is in my bedroom (fits PERFECTLY on the window ledge next to my bed, blows right on me).Both have developed an annoying, high-pitched whine on both speeds, whether oscillating or not.  While I didn't expect 100% quiet, this has become an unbearable situation.  My husband is hard of hearing, so when he questions me in the middle of the night about the fan noise, I know it's bad.  The high pitch is probably the root cause.The on/off and oscillating control buttons are located at the bottom of the fan.  The pressure point on each is the outside edge of the button, not in the middle or anywhere on the button.  Learning that - finally - allows one-handed adjustments.  The air blows out of the entire fan opening, not just from the middle.Other than the whine (did I mention how high pitched it is?!), this fan meets my needs quite well.  The size is perfect, the wind output is great, I don't care about appearance/color, only functionality.  But the whine has made a whiner out of me even when I drink wine, so I'm now in search of a different, small footprint, plug in, oscillating tower fan.FYI - there's frequently other background noise in both locations - TV, conversation, music, etc.  Still need something stronger than wine.

Title: Blew Me Away
Review Content: Update 3-1-2018*** Still using the fan in the same exact spot. Hasn't broke or developed a squeak. RUNNING STRONG, LITTLE FAN.I bought this fan for my office. Here's a break down of how the fan is in a cubicle environment. Mind you, this is office etiquette.*There are 2 settings. High and loud, or nice breeze and quiet. (I don't think the first setting is terribly loud, but I could see some people saying to turn it down. You know the type of people I'm talking about. =P )*It oscillates about a half inch to the right and to the left. I'm about 2 feet away from mine right now and it sends a breeze about 18" wide. I don't know the geometry behind that.*You can stop the oscillation at any point and the fan will remain in that position.*The Power and Oscillation buttons are blue LED.*If you want the fan on your face you'll have to position high or low enough. There is no up and down adjustment. But that's obvious from looking at the item.Overall it's been a good purchase. Been using it for almost a month now with no issues.

Title: It's *NOT* a perfect desk fan
Review Content: This fan is only okay.  The small footprint is nice, however there are other issues I have with it that honestly don't make it worth it.  I work in an open office environment, and this fan is just too loud.  It has two speed settings - when you turn it on, it defaults to the highest speed setting, which is very loud.  To the point where I don't feel comfortable running it at this speed for fear of disrupting my cube neighbors.  The 2nd, lower speed is hardly any better.  It's a little less noisy, but still noticeably loud.  The ambient sound with the fan on and off is quite noticeable.Also, the speeds are too fast - this is a desk fan, which means it's probably sitting very close to you.  The low speed is still too fast and blows too much air.  I would have preferred the slow speed be the HI speed, and they offered an even slower speed.Also, the buttons are junk.  They are very hard to press, meaning one-hand operation is not possible.  You must either support the fan with your other hand or wedge it against something.  If you try to turn the fan on with one hand, it will just push the fan back and not turn on.For these reasons, this is not a very good desk/office fan.  If you are by yourself, or the fan is placed further away, maybe it's okay.  But if you intend on using it like I do, you are better off with something else.

Title: Almost Perfect
Review Content: This fan is absolutely almost perfect. It fits my needs, as I purchased it to go in my living room (I have a larger tower fan by Lasko I use in the bedroom). It does make a very audible hum on either setting, but that's actually a plus for me - it's just white noise. I can also see how the lights could cause issues in the bedroom at night, I definitely won't be using it in my bedroom for that reason (my larger Lasko has a blue light like this that does keep me awake if I forget to turn off that feature - that's really what this little fan needs, the ability to dim/turn off the light). My only complaint is that this little fan needs a larger rotation, even just by a few inches. It'll work for the length of, say, a full-sized couch, but that's about it. My living room is really small, so I was hoping it'd be able to reach both of our seating options. I'll be keeping it, I'll just have to move it around a lot and bring in an additional fan if we have company.

Title: Great for White Noise at Bedtime
Review Content: I bought this knowing how loud it was.  It is a perfect bedside fan that pumps out a decent amount of airflow, is compact, and loud enough to provide some white noise to aid in sleeping.Pros:- Great white noise- Compact footprint- Decent airflow- Hi / Low settingCons:- Not whisper quiet if you need that in a fan- Bright blue light when turned on, can be annoying when trying to sleep- Bit higher priced that comparable solutionsBasically, if you are looking for a quiet fan, look elsewhere.  It's not jet-engine loud, but it's not super quiet either.  Also the blue power button is a bit bright at night, so you may want to put some tape over it.  A bit pricier than some other fans we have around the home, but overall works perfectly for bedside white noise and light breeze at night.  Solid 4 stars.

A bit pricier than some other fans we have around the home, but overall works perfectly for bedside white noise and light breeze at night.  Solid 4 stars.

Title: Two Major Problems for me
Review Content: I purchased it for bedtime sweats. The size is wonderful the output was good. Everything is great except for two dealbreakers. 1. The power and oscillating buttons are too bright for a bedroom nightstand. 2. The location of the power button can cause the unit to move or tip when pushing it on. If it’s not for your nightstand, then all is perfect. It’s pass my return window so I am placing it in my guest bedroom.

Title: Description was incorrect. Had to fix the product but still enjoy it.
Review Content: I bought this fan cause of the timeline. I needed a gift and quick.  All similar fans would take longer to be delivered so I opted for a dented box buy. Saved a few bucks and it got here quick. It arrived in the dented box  but when opened it up the fan did not work and was damaged pretty bad.  So that is my complaint. The product was not described as well as it should have been or.... the second shipping maybe did it. . It's a fan.....I have fixed many things so...Me and my son opened it up and glued the parts that were broke back to place.  Fan works great and Momma loves it. It makes a high pitch sound when running but not so bad I wanna throw it away.  lol  We don't use the remote...As a matter of fact...I don't remember even seeing it...Oh well.. I am a second customer of this fan.  It works now and I will continue to shop Amazon for very affordable things.  :)

Title: Good
Review Content: Second review: So I had to knock off a star. I’ve had this fan about a year. I’ve hardly used it as we have had a fairly cold winter here in Tx for once and haven’t used my office much. So it has sat, untouched and unplugged in my office. I used it finally the passed three days to sleep and I’ve never slept better! I turned it on tonight and it suddenly stopped blowing any air! I’m super disappointed that it lasted only a year after only being used maybe 15 times. I’m ordering another one because I truly love this fan so hopefully it doesn’t let me downFirst review:Really love this on my desk! I get almost no air in my office and it gets so hot I can't study. So this helps a ton! I wish it cooled a larger area though. I know it's a desk fan but the cool air only goes out a very short distance. Also its loud!

Title: Perfect for a cubicle
Review Content: This fan is the perfect size to sit on my desk at work and keep me cool all day long. My office tends to be very warm, as one side of it is all windows that get the sun most of the day, and the normal air conditioning doesn't cut it.The two speeds are great: The lower puts out the perfect amount of air and is not too loud, almost sounding like white noise after a wile. The higher speed is louder, but not annoying, and puts out even more air, which is almost too much to run normally unless I want papers flying all over the place.I normally run the fan on the lower speed and leave it stationary, but if I'm moving around my cubicle a lot while working on a project, I oscillate it and it still works perfectly to keep me cool. I've had the fan for almost 4 years at the time of this review and it works just as great now as it did when I first got it.

Title: The perfect bedroom fan
Review Content: This is a great fan! It's quiet even on high speed, swivels to help spread the air, and lasts a long time.As a bonus it will last a while. I ordered this fan again after the old one quit at the ripe old age of seven.
Manually Corrected Review Content: This is a great fan! It's quiet even on high speed, swivels to help spread the air, and lasts a long time.As a bonus it will last a while. I ordered this fan again after the old one quit at the ripe old age of seven.

Title: Great air flow, sleek design, but a bit too loud
Review Content: I am overall pleased with this purchase. I bought the fan to use on my desktop at my office. It replaced a very old, very 70s green, round desktop fan so I must say that the sleek design of this fan is quite nice in comparison to its bulky predecessor. I like the color, it's not distracting for the office, and the oscillating feature is a plus. It moves air nicely and I am satisfied with the pushing power as I can stand about 5 feet away and still feel the air flow on the low setting. My only complaint: it is too loud. 'Quiet' is in the ear of the beholder, I think, because I read quite a number of reviews that say this fan is quiet, but it's definitely too loud for my office on the high setting and borderline too loud on the low setting. I don't think anyone is bothered by it and the low setting will probably be my default (and I'll take the great airflow over the noise), so I will keep this fan, for at least a while, to see how it works out.

Title: Sufficiently powerful elegant personal fan
Review Content: This fan does the job well and looks great on your desk without taking up too much room. It is powerful enough to cool one person on either of the two available settings, and it's nice and quiet. The oscillating function works great. I am overall very happy with this product.The two things I find mildly annoying:1) When turning the fan off while it is oscillating, it stops at whichever position it was oscillating at. While it's not a big deal, it drives me crazy, because I like it to be straight and aligned with the base while not in use, and if you turn it off at random, the top part may be pointing off the base to either side. So each time I want to turn it off, I have to wait for the top part to align with the base and then turn it off promptly. Not a good thing for a compulsive person.2) The switches aren't very ergonomic because you need two hands to operate: one to hold the fan in place, and another to push the button. With one hand only the fan will keep sliding out of reach and you'll never be able to turn it on/off.

With one hand only the fan will keep sliding out of reach and you'll never be able to turn it on/off.

Title: Moves good air but makes an annoying pulsating vibration sound.
Review Content: The size is compact, though somewhat tall but overall fits a variety of spaces on a desktop. It moves good air and I have no complaints about cooling off, moving air, etc.The noise it produces however, is suspect. Initially it's a low hum which was great and totally acceptable for an office environment. However, after maybe 2 weeks of use it began producing a higher pitched grinding sound that I'd describe as "wha-wha-wha-wha-wha-wha-wha" as the fan rotates (not oscillates) at speed as if something isn't lubricated correctly or moving freely. That's disappointing as this happens most of the time now. I have to turn it off when taking a call because I'm afraid it will be heard on the other end. Since it was initially quiet, I'm not sure a part or something degraded, or is a QC issue where something is out of spec/alignment. Maybe I'm just unlucky with my unit.Overall - Great air cooling, but my unit has a pulsating grinding sound that is unfortunate and somewhat annoying. I'd only recommend if you're able to quickly return it or have a louder environment where the odd sound won't be an issue.

Title: Quiet, Reliable, SpaceSaving, Modest Breeze
Review Content: I've used this fan - the Lasko 4000 Ultra-Slim - for two years now and decided to buy a couple more since it finally occurred to me that I could easily place one on a kitchen counter and the other on a sidetable where I read. They're so small and quiet that they don't clutter up the place nor attract unwanted attention from cats or children.The fan is quiet except a low hum; mostly from the air. I rarely notice it. The breeze generated is on the small side - it's a small fan! - but it's sufficient for working in a hot New Mexico office without a sweat and with only limited desk space. Two years of near daily use does suggest the fan's reliable.The downside? You could get an old-fashioned circular bladed fan for far cheaper than the Lasko and it'd probably move the air just as good. And I'll repeat: the air flow isn't that strong. The Lasko has 2 speeds and the slower speed is about as strong as someone blowing air at you or using a piece of paper as a fan. 3 speeds (Hi, Med, Low) would've been better; what this fan delivers is Med, Low.But it gets me through the day. Knock off $5-$10 or add another speed setting (a higher one) and it would be perfect. A six star product then.

Title: If you're seeking a very quiet or a strong fan skip this one
Review Content: I needed an extra fan to supplement my ceiling fan and a very older model circle desktop fan. My room gets all of the afternoon sun and it gets hot in here during the time I'm trying to sleep (nighttime work schedule). This fan is perfect for my needs. No, this fan is not as quiet as you may think but the circle fan I already have makes so much noise it drowns this one out completely. The kind of low whirring sound is all this one makes that I notice with mines. No the air flow isn't half as much as I would personally like but I believe a part of this having to do with only about half of the front is made for the air to go through even on the highest setting. The other half is solid plastic. I wouldn't make this my primary fan. It just doesn't move enough air for that. The buttons could be constructed better also. They are cheap, thin plastic. All in all for $24 I'd say I'll probably get my money's worth but this won't be one of those overachieving purchases.

Title: Exactly what I needed - small; quiet; moves air nicely UPDATE - Just bought another one
Review Content: I just received this and know that I'll like it.  I live in Phoenix and I like to bake.  So the oven heats up the kitchen sometimes and it's not a big deal but having this little fan on the counter will make things a bit cooler.  It's very nice; quiet; choice of oscillating or not; two level of air movement.  This is EXACTLY what I was looking for.  I would get one for the office but I have the opposite problem in the office.  I'm always cold.  So I have a desktop heater on my desk.  But if I were one of the people who is always hot, I'd buy a second one of these for my desk.  But people have to keep in mind that this is not a big fan that will cool a large area.  I just wanted one for the kitchen counter where I stand and do the work before cooking or baking.  NOT SURE WHAT HAPPENED TO THE FIRST ONE I BOUGHT -- PROBABLY GAVE IT AWAY TO A FRIEND WHO LIKED IT.  SO I JUST BOUGHT ANOTHER ONE.  AM JUST AS HAPPY WITH IT NOW AS THEN.

Title: Favorite fan
Review Content: Bought this to replace my bedside table fan, and it's actually quieter. It oscillates and has two settings. Will be buying two more for our camper
Manually Corrected Review Content: Bought this to replace my bedside table fan, and it's actually quieter. It oscillates and has two settings. Will be buying two more for our camper

Title: Good small quiet sleek inexpensive low-power fan with many uses
Review Content: Short Answer:Decent fan, but only for a small area or personal use.Detailed Answer:It's just over a foot tall, but it moves a good amount of air for its size, which is surprising for how quiet it is.  But it is obviously a pretty small fan, so don't expect it to cool the entire room.  Much better suited for a desktop or end table.  Also works great next to the bed.What I Like:It's built quite solidly.  It has two air speeds - medium and hi.  It has two oscillation speeds - low and off.  The approximate period of oscillation is a calm 21 seconds at either air speed.  The unit consumes a gentle 25 watts maximum, according to my Kill-A-Watt.What's Not To Like:The degree of oscillation is quite small - it sweeps an area of only about 30 degrees.  On the power button there is a blue L.E.D., which is cool and pleasant during the day, but overpoweringly bright at night.  I covered the light with black electrical tape so I could sleep.

Title: What a lousy design...
Review Content: I had a fan of this shape before but the buttons were on top, and it had a rubberized bottom, was well balanced and silent, but I can't remember the brand (was from Costco) and I lent to a friend at work, but it somehow was "lost".. I got this one for beside my bed so that when my cat and dog lie beside me in bed, the airflow along the bed will draw the hair and dander towards my air purifier. Seems simple enough, and it worked well with the other fan.. NOT THIS ONE.Pros: It was cheap enough, and it was quiet enough even though it only had two speeds (low was more like Medium and HiGH was too high and noisy).  I had it running pretty much continuously for the first week. Then it got cold out and I turned it off one day. That night I tried to lean over to turn it on, and that's when you realize design flaws. First, the buttons aren't on the top, so that you can just push down with a single finger. The fan sits on the shelf attached to the side of the waterbed and is on the outside of the headboard, so I had to get up every time I wanted to turn it on, because you had to push the buttons with so much force that it just slid around. You had to use both hands to turn it on; one hand to hold the top of it, the other hand to hold the bottom of it and then use your thumb to turn it on. I had it for several weeks of annoying agitation, and since it worked okay, I certainly couldn't return it just because I didn't like it.  So I did the next best thing.. I bought a replacement that has the buttons on the top, and then I took this one outside and ran over the P.O.S. with my Big Truck Tires !!  The satisfaction was immeasureable as I heard its little plastic guts crackle and crush under the weight of my off road tires.... Then I happily swept it up and put the remains in the trash, to never be bothered with such a flaw ridden design of a device ever again...

Title: 4 years old and going strong!
Review Content: I am a hot natured person and I has worked in a cubicle office where everyone was always cold. So it was hot and stuffy. Being in a cubicle I didn't have a lot of room and this little guy worked like a charm! I had it osculating every day for 10 hours a day Monday - Friday. I got a promotion and was moved to a bigger office with actual walls and i took my cubicle buddy with me. Works just as well in here as it did when I was in an open office. I still have it running all day on low osculating and still works like a charm. I only turn it off to go home in the evenings and of course i turn it off on Fridays. So it gets the weekends to relax..lol Love the look, love that it isn't loud like some tower fans and it fits just about anywhere. For sure would buy this again if it every decides to quit on me!

Title: Overall a great little fan...
Review Content: I bought this fan for my home office about 1 year ago.  I wanted a fan that didn't take up a lot of desk space, was quiet and wasn't too powerful on low setting.  This fan has met all these criteria.  The vertical design is a real space saver and looks attractive.  Too often even small fans on low setting blow too hard to be comfortable and blow everything off my desk.  On the low setting, this fan is very quiet and has just the right amount of force for a gentle breeze.  It oscillates very smoothly.  The two switches for fan speed (high/low) and oscillation (on/off) have cool small blue LED lights when turned on.  It really is a great little fan--my only criticism, which is why I gave it 4 stars, is that the switches have to be pressed so firmly that it takes two hands, one to hold the fan while using the other to press the button.  A softer switch or a rotary switch would allow one hand use and make this the perfect small fan.

Title: Great fan overall - just a little louder than I expected.
Review Content: Well, using this for the first time today at my desk at work.  I have my own office, although the walls between my office and others are very thin - we can hear each other sneeze and type.  I love the look of this fan and I love the amount of air coming through the fan and onto me.  It is really helping me to cool off on this hot and humid summer day.  Overall, I have no complaints about this fan and am very satisfied.  The only thing I will note is the noise level - the fan is slightly louder than I expected.  It is mostly a white noise type of noise, so it doesn't bother me in the least.  In fact, it helps to drown out the noises I often hear from the offices next to mine.  I did check with those in the office next to me to see if they could hear the fan, and they could not, so there is no real problem, but the noise level is certainly louder than I was expected from a little fan of this size.  Overall, very pleased.
Manually Corrected Title: Great fan overall - just a little louder than I expected.
Manually Corrected Review Content: Well, using this for the first time today at my desk at work.  I have my own office, although the walls between my office and others are very thin - we can hear each other sneeze and type.  I love the look of this fan and I love the amount of air coming through the fan and onto me.  It is really helping me to cool off on this hot and humid summer day.  Overall, I have no complaints about this fan and am very satisfied.  The only thing I will note is the noise level - the fan is slightly louder than I expected.  It is mostly a white noise type of noise, so it doesn't bother me in the least.  In fact, it helps to drown out the noises I often hear from the offices next to mine.  I did check with those in the office next to me to see if they could hear the fan, and they could not, so there is no real problem, but the noise level is certainly louder than I was expected from a little fan of this size.  Overall, very pleased.

Title: I've bought two
Review Content: Literally buying a second one. Works great. Especially in this heat. Cools you down,  cools the room down. Super small too so it's not an eye sore like a box fan

Title: FANtastic!
Review Content: I bought this for my bathroom counter. I'm always running hot - and trying to get ready when you're all hot and sweaty is awful. This was just what I wanted! I like that you have a choice on whether to use the oscillation feature, and that there are two speeds. The amount of space it needs is minimal - the footprint is pretty small. I love that it's tall and sleek - it's also super easy to clean. I noticed the little holes in the back were starting to collect dust - a quick wipe with a damp paper towel took care of that. This is a fantastic value and I would purchase it again in a heartbeat. I leave it running all the time - it's really quiet and it provides surprisingly good airflow. It arrives ready to "plug and play" out of the box - it's fully assembled and the operation is so simple that you don't even need to read the directions. I paid just over $20 for this great little fan - and consider it one of the best deals I've gotten in awhile!

Title: Great little fan
Review Content: I was looking for a desk top fan for my office and came across this Lasko in the store at a higher price. Amazon's price couldn't be beat.  The fan itself functions well and maintains a sleek attractive design.  The fan has two speeds, High and Low.  The High is a little on the noisy but moves air well, even across a midsized room.  The Low setting is much quieter and still moves ample air if you are sitting at a closer distance.  The oscillating fiction works well and covers a large span.  This function can be turned on and off at your will.  This fan does not "cool" the air, but the breeze is wonderful on hot day.  The only negative I have noticed is that once out of every ten times it is turned on, the fan is extra noisy,.  This can be solved by turning off the fan and turning it back on.  Overall, a great fan for a small office or bedroom.

Title: Worked great 1st few times, now it's super loud
Review Content: I bought this for my office and have used it maybe a half dozen times. I turned it on today and it was so loud! I haven't dropped it or banged anything into it. It sits on top of a cabinet I rarely use. I turned it off and back on, I tried to wiggle it to see if something came loose inside. There is no reasonable explanation as to why it randomly started rattling like something came loose. It happens on oscillate, still, high, and low speed.

Title: Nice for cubicle environment
Review Content: I've gone through a couple of cheap tower fans for my cubicle at work.  The bearings at the base always seem to go bad within a few months of steady use.  I have been using this one steadily for 1 1/2 years on my desk at work with no problems.  This is an even smaller form factor than the previous ones I have owned which is a plus.Pros:Small surface areaOn the slower of the two fan speeds it is almost silent with an adequate breeze from about 2-3 feet.Cons:I feel the higher setting is a little too much of a "whine" in close cubicle quarters but I also do not find this setting necessary for my purposes.The buttons are a little hard to push as well.  I actually have to hold the fan steady with one hand while pushing the buttons with the other.  This is really my biggest complaint.I would highly recommend this for someone looking to fill the same needs as myself.

Title: Small footprint and whisper quiet on low
Review Content: I never understood why my co-workers have fans in their cubicles until I got a thermometer in my cubicle. I thought in a thermostat controlled environment, it really isn't necessary. But I was wrong. The temperature is relativity constant throughout the day, but we have cool (72 degrees) and warm days (79 degrees). That 7 degree difference is very noticeable and this fan is perfect for the warm days. It is about 4 inches wide at the base and several inches taller than a foot. At high setting, you will hear the motor spin if you have it at your desk, but it shouldn't bother your colleagues in their cubicles next to you. At the low setting, I only notice it because of the wind that is blowing at my face. The oscillating function is useful as this is not a Dyson "Air Multiplier" so you might get annoyed by the "chopping" wind (I did) that this fan and any fan creates. But the desk version of the Dyson is probably 4 - 5x the size of this fan (when you count the circumference of the ring) that you will be glad to still have so much space on this desk with this fan compare to any other fan or the Dyson.

Title: Great office/desk fan
Review Content: Great little fan for an office setting or home office where it sits on a desk top. It’s not the quietest fan but if you’re not in a dead silent office with no cubicle walls, no one will really notice on low setting. It’s solid and doesn’t look cheesy. I’ve had this about a year in my office - I’m near a window so I need a fan even in the winter when the sun makes my cubicle too hot until I pull down nearby shades.Definitely recommend but no it’s not like the super expensive silent fans. It’s not loud by any means, but some office mates who are fussy may not love the humming. I have another “room essentials” fan that was $5-10 and that’s quieter, but also isn’t nearly as good and doesn’t oscillate which is important to me. I didn’t want one beam of air blowing on me at one speed all day.

Title: Owner for 8 years
Review Content: I purchased this fan in 2013. I have waited 8 years to write this review.Why you ask? Well because the fan just blew me away.For real. Great desk top fan. I use in a large office space to move the air around me. It has done a great job over the past eight years.As I sit in the same place watching the world goes by, I do it with a breeze in my face to remind me of the freedom I will experience one day.I have had to use an air compressor to clean the fan a couple times over the years. As well I have squirted a couple sprays of WD-40.So if you too are sitting in one place and need a companion to sit with you, always reminding you of the freedom you lack.THIS FAN IS THE ONE YOU WANT.

Title: I was going through a bad time and confined to a small space and needed ...
Review Content: I purposefully rarely write a review for an actual product. I was going through a bad time and confined to a small space and needed air circulation. This fan became part of the structure for the framework of re-normalizing my life. I had been through a really hard time, and I'm in this room, and the room has a deck. The deck pulls heat in and shovels it towards me, where I work during the day. The plastic slat blinds hanging, impotently, added no aid to me in this room I was in, they could not stave the unruly force of the wood absorbing, rarefactting, transducing my sorrow into abominable heat and sweat and derelict ideals of yesterday. Can we even have an idea of yesterday at all that is not derelict? When I ordered this fan, it was the zenith , or crux, if you will, of achieving self reliance and thoughts unfettered by confusion. For, I was in need of a fan that could not only be acceptable in a music studio environment, but also was tiny. My darker days, lo, they have passed. And when the clouds broke: there was the fan.

Title: Nice fan
Review Content: Nice little fan. I have had this for more than a month now, running it for 6 hours a day at my work desk and it puts out plenty of air for that application. However it is starting to make noises.. They usually go away pretty quickly, but if they get worse I will be dropping my rating.Edit.. The fan no longer starts without making a terrible squeal.. Lasted only a month or so.. Will try contacting seller to see if it can be replacedAnother edit 6/5/19.Amazon sent me another fan, the new one is holding up after a year and makes no noises. Happy with the purchase, maybe the original one I got was faulty.Third edit 10/22/20Still functioning well after many many hours of use.

Title: This is not a quiet fan!
Review Content: My dog is 16.5 and requires a fan on him 24/7. We wanted a quiet, oscillating fan to keep him (and us) comfortable.I wish I could give this fan higher stars; however, I purchased it specifically because it was supposed to be a quiet fan - and it is truly one of the loudest I’ve ever owned.It has a horrible whining noise on either setting. When on low it clicks. And when oscillating, it makes a distinct high pitch noise about 80% of the time. Ones in awhile, it just goes awol and starts screeching at the top of its lungs. This requires it to be shut off and turned back on.Given the other reviews, it’s possible I just got a dud. But before I even tried it, we had removed it from the packaging and discarded all packaging - so there was no returning it.We’ve lived with it for 7+ months and it still runs the same. Seems durable and like it will last quite a bit longer. Until this one croaks, I’ll continue to wear ear plugs when I sleep to block out the whining sounds.

Title: I would not recommend the Lasko 4000 Air Stik Ultra-Slim Oscillating Fan.
Review Content: Okay so for the first week and a half of using the fan worked as described, it was quiet (not super quiet on the higher setting) so at night i put it on the low setting. Then later into the 2 week mark i started hearing a grinding noise that came every 2-4 seconds on top of that the fan was a lot weaker than it started off as. I did not use the fan daily and when it was not in use it was unplugged. My 30 day warranty passed which stinks because i didn't use the fan right away i didn't notice there was a 30 day only warranty for returns. Which is my fault. Anyway. i Contacted amazon support and they helped me the best they could but since the 30 day warranty was up they couldn't process a return/exchange and told me to contact Lasko itself, which i'm going to do now.I just want to say i did love the fan at first until the grinding noise started happening and now the fan isn't as strong as it used to be, to me this was a waste of my money and i will not be buying this product again.I also want to add Lasko brand is a good brand. i have a Large stand up fan from them that has worked for years and it is still going strong. Which is why i bought their small fan over other brands.  So i just wouldn't recommend the Lasko 4000 air stik ultra-slim oscillating fan.

Title: Relief from the heat
Review Content: I just moved to a workspace where the temperature is much too warm for my comfort. My desk is quite small so after reviewing the options I purchased the Lasko 4000. The low speed is more than sufficient to keep me cool and I love that it oscillates without making any additional noise. My traditional fans always seem to rattle and vibrate. That said, the fan is not completely silent but it certainly is not extremely loud either. I don't agree with the complaints about it being too noisy. Right now I have it on the low setting and I can still perfectly hear my radio which is turned down quite low, the people around me talking on their phones and even the person in the next cube chewing her ice. The high speed is noisier, but still, not so much that one can't talk on the phone or hold a conversation with it on.I'm going to purchase a second one for my bedroom. The footprint is small enough that I will be able to place the fan on my night stand without interfering with the other items there. Either speed isn't so noisy that it will prevent sleeping.

Title: and it works great as a desk fan
Review Content: I give this item 3 stars, only because it performs its given duty, which is moving air. The fan is actually quite powerful for it's size, and it works great as a desk fan. I, however, wanted to use it as a travel fan to help me sleep when I'm away from home. The problems with this fan lie in a couple of areas. I'm not exactly sure why fan manufacturers thought installing absurdly bright LED's onto their fans was a good idea. The LED buttons on this fan require covering if you pan on sleeping in a semi-dark room at night. I ended up putting a sock in front of the fan to cover up the absurd light emitted from the fan. The other problem I have with the fan is the high pitched whine that the electric motor produces. I've heard somewhat similar sounds from other fans and it always annoys me, however with this fan it is particularly loud. I enjoy white noise produced from fans while sleeping which is one of the reasons I purchased this fan for travel, however this noise actually makes it difficult to sleep with. I docked a star for both the LED lights and the high pitched whine this fan produces.

Title: Awesome quite desk fan!
Review Content: I sit next to a window that the sun shines on at work, so during the afternoon it gets pretty warm around my desk, especially during the hot days. Sometimes I would have to take a small break and stand next to the air conditioning vent to cool off a bit. Ever since I bought this fan, my heat problems have been solved and haven't had to take an AC break. It has 2 speed settings and it is very quite on the low setting so it does not bother me or any of my co-workers. I've only had to use the high setting a few times when temperatures hit the 100's, but even then it wasn't loud enough to bother anybody. This little fan pushes out a good volume of air for its size and I really like the look of it. Another plus is that the profile is slim so it does not take up a lot of room on my desk. A couple of my co-works have also purchased the same fan after they saw me using it. Would definitely recommend it or buy it again if needed.

Title: Works as expected
Review Content: It's a little loud for me on high speed, but it's also on my nightstand so that would explain the loudness. So far, it's worked really well. This is my second purchase. The first one lasted about three years.
Manually Corrected Review Content: It's a little loud for me on high speed, but it's also on my nightstand so that would explain the loudness. So far, it's worked really well. This is my second purchase. The first one lasted about three years.

Title: Compromises noise and effectiveness to save space
Review Content: I bought this fan to use in my office space, after being very happy with full-sized column fans. Unfortunately, I didn't have a similar experienced with this one.My priorities were: 1) quiet, 2) small, and 3) effective. This fan is small, but doesn't do well on the other features. That makes it an expensive 'emergency' fan that I'll only use if I'm extremely hot, rather than keeping it on. And, I have to slouch to cool my face / head.Pro:+ SMALL. footprint is about the size of two credit cards, or a little larger than a dollar bill folded in half+ Nice looking. It looks solid and well constructed, and has a nice finish.Con:- NOISY. The noise is the same timbre as a hair dryer, though admittedly much quieter. Noisier than normal desk fans I've had though.- Buttons. To push the buttons, you have to hold the back of the fan to keep from pushing it over. The fan shape makes it unstable when nudged.- Narrow band of effect. The fan sends air out in about the same shape and size as the grill. If you're not in exactly the right spot, it doesn't hit you. Also, since you can't adjust it up and down, you can't aim it at higher targets like your face.- Oscillation range is very small. At 3' from the fan, it oscillates enough to cover perhaps 2' side to side. It sounds like a lot more than it feels like.I expected to get a quiet, not terribly effective fan. Instead, I got a noisy one. I would not buy this again and would not recommend it unless you're OK with your desk fan just hitting your torso, and sounding like (though quieter than) a hairdryer.

Title: Kinda loud
Review Content: Its small and powerful but its loud. Not a constant noise but has a clicky sound. I had returned one for a high pitch squealing sound. The second is still pretty loud but at least doesn't have the squealing

Title: The small footprint is perfect next to one of my computer screens and is ...
Review Content: This little fan is exactly what I was in need of. The office space I am in runs warm, to the point I'd say steamy and uncomfortable. The small footprint is perfect next to one of my computer screens and is doing a nice job of moving the air around me and my seat. It's fairly quiet however I'm in a loud space. it rotates approximately 30 degrees or you can switch that feature off. The two speed fan is enough considering that I have it about two feet from me.My only small complaint is that the both switches are stiff and the fan is not heavy enough to stay in place when pushing the buttons.I would buy this same fan again and recommend it to friends.

Title: Owned this for 4 years and.......
Review Content: If you live in a somewhat dusty environment then expect this fan to make some noise.  When I first bought this is started making a harsh noise like the bearings of the fan where grinding. I thought I would have to disassemble the unit to fix it but first I tried something simple.  I hit the top of the unit with a quick sharp but careful strike to attempt to reseat the fan. It worked. The fan still makes some noise and has for years. But the fan has worked flawlessly since that initial problem. On for 4-6 hours a day 4 or 5 months out of the year.  It is very worth the money. A great, powerful, compact, reliable unit. Highly recommended.

Title: Very good fan
Review Content: The fan is a good size, but the noise level on low is still fairly audible from 2 feet away. I would compare it to vehicles air conditions blower set to halfway. Perhaps after some lubrication of the shaft it will quite down some.This fan only has three settings, Off, High , and low, I wish there was a dimmer switch for controlling the fan speed.At two feet away the air isn't to strong, if it wasn't for the sound it would almost be perfect.The slim design is great, the color's scheme is great too.It's been about a month now and I tried using the swizzle feature for the first time. It only worked for about 5 minutes then the rotating motor got stuck.Still useful not a big deal for me, but you might want to check that when you get yours.

Title: it works, i guess
Review Content: I bought this hoping for a more compact fan than the Vornado Zippi I have on my work desk.  While this is a lot taller, I figured if it did the trick it would save on desk space and I wouldn't have to worry about touching the soft blades of the Vornado and making weird noises.Unfortunately on low, while it's quiet, it hardly moves any air at all.  On high it moves an acceptable amount of air but is also surprisingly loud.  It seems like it really needs a medium setting that balances noise and air better.Everything does what it should otherwise, aside from the fact that occasionally when turned on it seems slightly off  kilter with a slight rattle.  Giving it a wack on the top seemed to sort that out.  I was going to return it but my SO liked it for her desk at work, so it has stayed with us and I'll just keep using the Zippi.

Title: I was looking for a small quiet air circulator which did not make me feel like I was in a wind tunnel
Review Content: I bought this fan to use in my cubicle at work. I was looking for a small quiet air circulator which did not make me feel like I was in a wind tunnel. Based on the reviews I chose this tower over other small fans for its size, quietness and air movement ability. I liked the oscillating feature along with the two speeds.Pros1. This fan moved the air just the right amount for my needs. I didn't feel blasted by the air or wonder if it was working either.2. The fan took up very little space.3. Sleek look with easy access to the controls.Con1. Annoying hum with a click at both speed settings with or without the oscillation. The motor sound  had a clickety sound as if a string was attached to the motor and hit something every time it rotated.Needless to say, the fan went right back with my husband's "I told you to get a Vornado" ringing in my ears. Our Vornado 530 Compact was much quieter. I am hoping the Vornado 133 Small Air Circulator I ordered (desk size) will follow suit.Good Luck with your search!

Title: very particular about my fans
Review Content: I wanted something small for my night stand that wasn't on the floor. This blends into the room without the obtrusiveness of the big floor fan. I am a white noise sleeper and after a few nights I got used to the difference and have no problem with the noise. I do however wonder why in the design process they felt the need to put a blue light on the buttons that would bring in planes. I paited the button with nail polish which worked on the surface but the light glows behind the button and the only solution is to tape is over the buttons which means you have to retape after access. So it lost a star. Now for the fan output it is a powerful little unit worthy of any solution to nighttime menopause. I only wish I didn't have to ruin the sleek look with tape.

Title: Small, Quiet, I can't say it's weak, but not super powerful.
Review Content: Pros:Smallish. About the size of a cup coaster if one was about as tall as a ruler.Quiet.press a button and it moves side to side.Cons:Side to side motion stops wherever it stops when you click the button. Doesn't go back to a specific place, so it could end up turned to one side in comparison to the base... not great for OCD, but other than that, not a big deal, you time clicking the button when it's in position.Neutral/Con (why I deducted a star):Fan is not super powerful. Don't get me wrong, it's useful and works. For how small and quiet it is, it's pretty darn powerful.Edit:7/11/2018After 3 years, the fan no longer works to move air, though it still turns side to side. It was overall good while it lasted.

Title: Pleasant Little Wonderful Surprise
Review Content: I've been scouring on-line for a replacement for my small nearly-silent battery operated fan (replacing the two D batteries every few days is just insane).  I purchased an electric fan earlier hoping it would be super quiet but returned because it was, in my opinion, very noisy.  I knew I would not be able to sleep with that rumbling in my face.  I'd all but given up and started to order another slew of batteries when I came across this Lasko and thought I'd give it a try.  VOILA!  This little fan is amazing.  It not only moves quite a bit of air, it is very quiet (just the right decibel for me) and oscillates; a bonus. If you're looking for quiet little fan to just move a bit of air in your personal space, with a tad bit of noise to sleep by, give this  Lasko Ultra-Slim a try.  It is wonderful.

Title: Noisy but Nice
Review Content: The reason I ended up buying this fan instead of another is because of a review claiming it is quiet. It IS quiet when it's not turned on, so I suppose that's not a total falsehood. The person who posted that review probably just has different hearing abilities than I do; this fan is not quiet when running. It is, however, a decent fan. If you don't mind your fan not being quiet, you may enjoy this fan. It is compact, taking up very little desk space. It blows well and far for such a compact fan. I am on the fence as far as keeping it, as I don't want to become the office annoyance due to my new fan. If not for the noise level, I might have given it five stars.

Title: Not what I expected, but not displeased either
Review Content: So I bought this fan without really reading the description, mainly went off reviews and price.  I did not realize how tiny it was, however that is my error since the product clearly states it is 14 inches in description.  Despite its small size, it still works pretty well and it fairly quiet.  I intended for this to be in my bedroom at night, however due to its small size and glaring blue space light buttons on the front (My ENTIRE room was lit up from the button illumination) it will be better suited at my office on a tabletop or desk.I still gave the product 4 stars because it is a nice little fan and would be perfect at work or maybe in a child's room where they like the nightlight anyway.

Title: Moves Air, But Not That Quietly..
Review Content: I got this for office desk use, as intended I suppose.  I'm keeping it, it works, but the noise level on low setting is the sound I hear until I get the music up.  Two speed settings (press the power button one to turn on high, press again to go low, then again to OFF.  The high is too high and too loud for my situation.  A co-worker found some computer case fans at a comparable price that are way quieter.. move as much air, but you'll need to qualify as a DIY'er.  Still, gave it 4 stars as it works.

Title: Works nicely, but could be stronger.
Review Content: The fan has a convenient turning feature, which comes in handy for nights when it's too cold for a constant blast from the fan but too warm for no fan. The glowing buttons can be convenient I'm sure, but to me, they are kind of annoyingly bright when I am trying to sleep. That is just my own preference though, as I need a pitch black environment to sleep. If there were one thing to justifiably complain about though, it would be the power of the fan. It's just way too low, when I could get much more powerful fans for the same price. Still a nice fan though, and powers through the nights perfectly well.

Title: Powerful little unit!
Review Content: Perfectly sized for my desk, attractive design, powerful.  Unit has a high and low setting. Living in Florida and working from home,  my office on the 2nd floor can get quite warm in the afternoons. I positioned this unit next to my screen and right away realized that even at the low setting, the fan had to be set a bit further away from me...it's that strong!  I love that it can also oscillate.  Downfalls? Nothing too important hence I didn't deduct a star but (1) it's a bit louder than i anticipated.  Not loud, but not quiet.  (2) the buttons feel cheap. It could be the unit I received, but when i press the ON button, it feels loose and like it might eventually come off. Hmm. As I write this, I wonder if perhaps I should ask for a replacement...

Title: Powerful

Title: A very quiet fan!
Review Content: -It was said that this fan is not quiet, This is definitely not true. The motor makes absolutely no noise what so ever, the only thing you hear is the sound created by the fans from spinning (which is impossible to prevent!). You can literally stand not even 5 feet away and its barely audible on low setting, the high setting is still really quiet.-Takes up very little space. Touch the tips of your pointer finger and thumb together like a circle and that's about the space it takes up, only about 14inches tall. The light for the buttons aren't as bright as some people claim in other reviews as well.-Generates a nice calm breeze on low, and the high setting generates some really nice airflow, I work in  double wide cubical and it's a dream. I think there was a review that said the oscillation wasn't very much. Come on seriously?? How much oscillation do you need for a desk area?-My one and only thing is that you kinda have to hold the base a little bit to press the buttons.

Title: Powerful and efficient - excellent product
Review Content: I bought this Lasko Wind Machine because I have another Lasko (a 16" table fan) but needed one for much warmer months with more wind. I can use both by having one blow out one window while the other blows in.This fan ( actually air circulator ) is fantastic. It’s like getting a wind chill in your house.We had some real warm days and I eventually turned on the air conditioning- but I turned it up to 76 ° and pointed the fan directly at the ceiling. It really helped to disperse the cool air that way while not having to turn the air conditioning temperature lower- thereby using less energy.On days where AC isn’t needed, this fan provides a nice breeze with the windows open, blowing that cool air around from outside. ( the house is tight- so when it’s warm in here and a few degrees cooler  outside - this works really well. )Very versatile machine. Can be pointed straight down in winter to disperse warm air, up to spread the cool air- pointing  out the window to exhaust- just a real great circulator all around, with Lasko’s  blue safety plug.I’m enclosing a photo of my Wind Machine. I painted the blue parts white because my decor doesn’t have any blue and I wanted it to blend in rather than stand out. I keep it a room that’s mostly white and seafoam green with a light grey flooring - not the room in the photo.Extremely easy to take apart- the side knobs come off- the handle comes off- easy to clean.Very well built circulator- worked right out of the box. Sturdy and all 3 speeds are powerful. Not real loud even on the highest setting.I get that the cords can’t be super long for a reason but another 10-12" would give more options for placement since you can not use extension cords with fans or circulators for safety reasons.Still a 5 star 🌟 machine. Definitely recommend!
