Title: Great Fan, Terrible Name
Review Content: Previously I had 2 identical $39.00 desktop fans with a remote. On the first one, the remote died within 2 months. So I ordered a new fan, but when I got it, it was the same as the one that died. I mis-purchased. The remote on that one died within one month. Well, I have to admit it. I am a cheapskate. I bought the cheapest desktop fan with remote that I could find. There was another one close in price, $4.00 more, but, the name was Doctor Prepare. Tell me, would you buy a fan with a name like that? So this time I bought one. What a difference. It has 8 speeds. It has 8 hours of timing. The fan is much more quiet. The case is much more substantial. It is made of heavy duty plastic. There is almost no vibration. It is much better than the mere $4.00 difference. But, the name. Dr. Prepare. Really? Would you buy a fan with that name? Well if you like my review, don't be afraid based on the stupid name.

Review Content: Sin duda el punto mas postitivo es lo ligero que es y facil de transportar o manejable. Pero para las altas que temperaturas que tenemoa aqui en USA no sirve de mucho o nada. Incluso en la velocidad mas alta (8) lo unico que hace es mover ire caliente. Obviamente ya sabia que no iba a ser como un aire acondicionado pero si esperaba sentir mas "fresco". Respecto al ruido, es silencioso siempre que no pase de la cuarta velocidad...lo cual es dificiñ ya que para notar algo tienes q ponerlo minimo al 5,6 o 7...y ahi si hace ruido, aunque solo es molesto para dormir. Otra cosa que si es muy comoda es que tenga mando a distancia.

Title: Nice little fan
Review Content: I bought this specifically for a bathroom to help dry the shower/tub area, along with the ceiling exhaust fan. Living in FL, excess humidity in the bathroom is problematic due to possible mold and mildew growth. Turning this fan on, on #8 (high) for an hour or two, with the ceiling vent fan, completely drys the walls and tub. No mold or mildew...ever!!It's 6" footprint makes it the perfect size to sit on the counter top in the corner, out of the way...and well away from any water. (Sink)

Title: Best Fan
Review Content: If you’re going to get a fan, THIS IS THE ONE YOU WANT. I was on the hunt for a metal fan since they blow air far better than plastic fans so I bought this one in copper.The written instructions were very small, the picture talking about what was what unfortunately was faded and could barely be seen. Thankfully even without instructions this fan is very simple to assemble.This thing BLOWS air, so if you’re looking for feeling like you’re in a wind tunnel then this is for you. It can be somewhat loud when on high, but that’s to be expected with any fan. It is heavy and held it place extremely well by the base weight it comes with, so you won’t have to experience shaking unless you didn’t properly tighten some pieces.Overall I’m extremely happy with this purchase.

Title: Beautiful.. but missing parts
Review Content: Alright, let me just say—I am OBSESSED with how this Holmes 16" Copper Digital Metal Stand Fan looks. The Coppertone finish makes it look like it belongs in some fancy old-timey library where rich people sip whiskey and talk about "the economy." It’s got major vintage vibes but with modern features, which I love. The remote control is also a game-changer. I don’t have to move an inch to adjust the speed or oscillation—pure luxury.But, of course, my excitement was immediately tested because—guess what was missing from the brand-new box? The anchor screws that actually hold the fan to the stand. You know, a crucial part of making sure it doesn’t fall over like a sad, expensive paperweight. Returning it would’ve been a pain, so I took matters into my own hands.Cue me standing in Home Depot, trying to explain to the poor employee that I needed “fan screws” without having any clue what size they were. He looked at me like I had three heads before finally just handing me a variety pack and wishing me luck. After some trial and error (and probably concerning my neighbors with my excessive use of profanity), I finally found ones that fit.Once assembled, though? Absolute perfection. It’s quiet, powerful, and looks like something Gatsby himself would’ve owned. If it came with all its parts, it’d be an 11/10. But since I had to go on a screw-hunting adventure, solid 9/10.

Title: Exactly what I needed.
Review Content: I love this fan and have used it pretty much every single night since I got it. It is so quiet I never hear it running. And it is awesome with the amount of air it circulates around. I actually got this to replace the air flow I am no longer getting from a ceiling fan. I let someone else install the ceiling fan a long time ago that I wish I had not done, because I have installed these myself and did it right the first time. Since this person who should have known what they were doing, but obviously did not. They pressed on the movable part of the fan to check for sturdiness instead of the actual part the actually holds the weight of the fan from the ceiling. This was a small inexpensive ceiling fan mind you. But after only a couple of years it is already not putting out enough air to even feel it. And because it was not properly installed, if you turn it on high speed it rattles and makes to much noise for me. Just makes me angry to the point I will be having to remove it. In the meantime I decided to go back to old school and just get this stand up fan and I am so very glad I did. It is the perfect height, takes up very little space. And provides an incredibly good flow of air even at the lowest speed setting. The price was fair, I will mention these new installation instructions are not quite as good as they used to be. Maybe I am just getting old. But I have installed so many different things and put together so many things that good old fashioned common sense has gotten me through. So on your scale of 0 to 5 for that? I would give about a 3 rating. But, still it was not that difficult and actually I found a you tube video that confirmed the placement of the bottom of the stand. I was also missing one screw to attach the bottom but I am getting by without it. I almost messaged the seller to send me another one, but didn't want to bother with it. It seems to be holding up just fine. It is not heavy anyway, but am listing here just so the buyer will know. You don't have to do anything to make up for it. I just thank you that the fan works wonderfully, it is so nice and quiet and overall I am very happy with it. Thank you again so much and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a good fan, especially with the heat of summer right around the corner. Thanks again.

Title: Moves a lot of air, quietly (but needs one quick dab of glue to future-proof it).
Review Content: For airflow, this is the best pedestal fan I've tried. It moves quite a bit of air on the fastest setting without it getting into "excessively windy" range. Despite this, it is suprisingly quiet, much more so than my box fax, or even the (junk) vertical tower fan I tried.However, it has one, non-serious flaw. The plastic "Part E, Rear Grill Mounting Nut", cannot really be tightend very much (or you'll strip it), and it consequently works its way loose very quickly. Happened to me in less than 24 hours, with the result that the grill "cage" came loose and came noisily into contact with the fan. Fortunately didn't do any damage.The 5-minute fix was to take it partially apart and glue this "Mounting Nut" into place. There's never going to be a reason to remove it, so there's no reason not to. Just do that as you're putting it together.If not for that issue, I would have given this 5 stars, as a clearly superior fan to many of the competitors (or any shape or size). I'm really happy with it.PS: As some others have noted, the "Part C, Blade Cap" is not threaded in the standard "lefty-loosey, righty-tighty" manner, but has to be screwed on backwards. This is actually smart; it's so that it cannot work itself loose in the course of the fan spinning clockwise. They should have done this also with Part E.

Title: Just get it!
Review Content: Giving this 4 stars because it was not a 5-10 minute task, required two people, and used frustratingly small and inconveniently placed screws. Get your toddlers ready, because you will need their tiny hands for this!I was able to reach most of them with a screw driver extender, except for the one at the base. The caged piece is in the way of the grill locking screw (second picture), but I think the clips will suffice. The instructions also say to put this screw in first - leaving the clasps closed, which I would not recommend since it hooks from the top (and the screw won’t hold). Also hoping that the fuse does not need to be replaced often, but keep your instructions just in case you need information on what to buy/how to install it!Overall, I am a fan. 🥁 I had to turn it on low shortly after turning it on. It cooled the whole room in minutes! I will definitely be glad I have this in the summer time!
Manually Corrected Review Content: Giving this 4 stars because it was not a 5-10 minute task, required two people, and used frustratingly small and inconveniently placed screws. Get your toddlers ready, because you will need their tiny hands for this!I was able to reach most of them with a screw driver extender, except for the one at the base. The caged piece is in the way of the grill locking screw (second picture), but I think the clips will suffice. The instructions also say to put this screw in first - leaving the clasps closed, which I would not recommend since it hooks from the top (and the screw won’t hold). Also hoping that the fuse does not need to be replaced often, but keep your instructions just in case you need information on what to buy/how to install it!Overall, I am a fan. 🥁 I had to turn it on low shortly after turning it on. It cooled the whole room in minutes! I will definitely be glad I have this in the summer time!

Title: Good for the price

Only issue I have is that it’s a little bit shorter than I thought it would be, but if you need a fan for any room. I think this is a great product. It’s really come in handy.

Title: It works
Review Content: Just keep in mind that the low setting is like the medium setting on other fans and the medium setting is like the high setting. You can imagine what the high setting is like. Another thing, once turned on and you use the remote, you have to double click your choice. Make certain the red lights on the face of the fan are on otherwise the remote won't activate any option you choose. I can't seem to override this and there's nothing in the manual about it. Weird. This keeps me from giving it 5 stars.

Title: Difficult assembly
Review Content: first, why I gave it 3 stars; I've bought  many pedestal fans over the years and always have had to assemble them. It's typically not difficult, however this fan is 99.9% plastic and the inferior parts quality  is very obvious.  The screens are all plastic and difficult to align - mostly because the plastic does not retain it's shape and they don't line up easily at all.  The inner locking ring stripped when I first put it on, (praying it stays in place and I won't have to return it).  The instruction are worthless. The pedestal and poles proved to be of inferior quality from previous models as well.On a positive note, I have been using it and it generates a nice breeze and is pleasingly quiet, much quieter than the  fan it replaced.  So after getting impatient with the assembly it seems the fan is doing what I wanted it to do.  Just a note to the Holmes people, we know business is difficult with this economy, but please pay attention to the poor quality parts and the difficult assembly,

Title: Powerful airflow
Review Content: Fan is so powerful that I rarely need to go above the low setting! In fact, my main complaint is there is no true low. If you are looking for a strong breeze, I highly recommend it. However, I prefer a gentle breeze, which is why it's not five star for me. Remote works pretty well, although you have to point it directly at the sensor. If you're an inch or so above or below then it won't respond to the remote. Assembly was easy enough when I followed along with the YouTube video.

Title: Worst fan to assemble
Review Content: This is not the first fan I’ve purchased and attempted to assemble, but it’s the worst. Took over an hour, turned it on and it didn’t spun. Took the front housing off, spun manually and it then started spinning. I loosened the cap, put the housing back on, didn’t spin. The next day, I tried again. No go. It’s now without the front housing. Ridiculous. Not returning, too much of a hassle, but I don’t recommend this. There are other fans that function far better and aren’t a pain in the butt to assemble. Buy one of those.

Title: Fan Great But . . .
Review Content: For $40.00, I got a terrific fan that blows out hi-powered or hurricane style wind out.  Medium is the highest level I would go to keep me cool because High blows everything off of the walls.I was kept cool all summer long, but I could not hear anything over it.  It's pole keep leaning over and becoming loose.  I had to frequently turn the bottom piece just to tighten the pole to prevent it from leaning.  The fan's height also would frequently shift normal to short as the summer went on.  I found myself frequently turning the height adjuster on the middle of the pole to keep the fan at a normal height.Aside from the few negatives, this fan was of good quality, easy to put together without tools, and it keeps easily too.

Title: Awesome oscillating fan with remote!
Review Content: I love to sleep with a fan any time of year for the noise and the breeze. In the past I have usually gone with a box fan. However, finding something or a place to keep a box fan elevated and not on the floor was always frustrating. I viewed quite a few of these taller oscillating fans purposely looking for a fan that made noise similar to a box fan and yet still had the same power as a box fan.After viewing quite a few and going over reviews and seeing some of these reviews I was a little hesitant but also wanted a noisy fan. I decided to try this fan and I am not disappointed at all. Actually I am totally happy I made this purchase and the remote along with the different modes (not just fan speeds! It has a night mode and a softer breeze mode) and the oscillation so it doesn’t stay stagnant and the noise has me hooked!! The night mode, the fan makes a more prominent fan noise, definitely for people who can’t sleep without the white noise from a fan and it also has a timer feature for the days/nights of hot flashes or night sweats.This fan has really exceeded my expectations and then some!!A must have for people who love to sleep with a fan for the noise and the breeze!! The remote is just the cherry on top.

Title: Fire
Review Content: Quite, powerful, love the look, BUT after 2 months it stuck on Breezing and would not reset. A week later it bursted into flames when it was turned on. Sadness ensued.

Title: A little flimsy
Review Content: All in all for the price it’s not a bad fan. Lots of different features like speed, oscillation, and a few others make it a decent value. That said the construction is a little flimsy and a bit shaky on the stability. On several occasions, even after tightening the fan housing, I went to go move it and it came detached from the base. It did not cause any damage and I was easily able to put it back together but as a whole for $30, you get what you pay for. Lastly, the instructions that came with it were difficult to read. It came with very little wording, and just pictures of the parts, and how they should fit together The tightening screw that is meant to hold the body of the fan to the pole, seems to be a little short and doesn’t allow the housing to tighten as firmly to the pole as it should. That is what causes some of the stability issues.

Title: HEY! IT'S A $34 FAN. DOES ANYONE READ ANY RATINGS THAT ARE NOT 1 OR 5?

IT IS USED FOR WHAT YOU WOULD USE A CHEAP, LIGHT, PORTABLE FAN FOR, TO BLOW SOME AIR IN YOUR FACE WHEN IT'S HOT. Title: Quiet and plenty of breeze.
Review Content: For the price this is a good floor standing fan. It is very quiet at the 3 different speeds. One thing to pay close attention to is the maximum height. Fully extended the top of the fan cage is 44" and the center of the fan blades is 36", so if you need a fan than is taller, look elsewhere.  The remote is handy and works good. You'll need to read the instructions to know what the mode setting does and how to set the timer.Overall this was a good buy and works well as a floor fan that is easy to carry around. The cord should be another 2 or 3 feet longer, but there are always extension cords.

Title: Fans Arrived Not Working Correctly- Low Quality Over Many Design Aspects
Review Content: Fans are good design aero-wise in style. Good force of breeze put out. 5 Stars for force of the air current, oscillation/rotation.Trouble is the overall quality of the merchandise. Oorderd two. Both are cheaply made in the coverings and one of them literally was defective at the oscillation directly out of the box. Never operated correctly and makes unnecessary noise straight out of the box. Therefore- do not use the rotational part of the fan at all. Must keep it at Stationary (BTW that part built into ALL of the Holmes fans I have recently purchased are cheaply made).Strongly cosidering avoiding HOLMES in the future altogether as evrey single one is very unreliable and of poor design when putting toether.The parts one uses to hold the fans and the fan backing literally come out and off after use after two weeks or so. Leaving the consumer with having to take all apart and re-tighten down again.There are NO grips at all for the fingers- smooth and therefore nearly impossible to tigthen down securely.The casings are cheap platic snal togethers and after one- two times of taking apart and putting back together are not seaming up tight;y.Very disappointed. Very disappointed. They look cool but need to be well made and not fall apart right out of the box or within the first 30 days.

Title: Love this fan
Review Content: I have been using this fan for about a month now and it has been great.  I use it to help distribute the air from the A/C vent in the ceiling in my office that does not have a ceiling fan.  My dog loves to lie right in front, lol.  I love the remote, the oscillating function and fact you can easily change the height.  The instructions could have had more detail in a couple of areas but I was able to put it together in less than an hour (and putting things together is one of my least favorite things).  I am thinking of getting a second one that I can use in second room. It is also light weight and easy to move around.  Overall, it is great value for the price and I would recommend.

Title: Good value
Review Content: Good value, sturdy enough and not too painful to put together. I couldn't locate the tiny grill lock screw but you can easily go without or use a small zip tie. Be aware that due to the "digital" controls, you can't really use this fan with a smart plug. You can turn it off by cutting the power to the fan but when you turn the plug back on you'll need to manually turn the fan on and set the speed - there is no "memory" of the last setting after it loses power.

Title: Good customer service
Review Content: Had a hiccup when assembling, the blade cap that holds the blades onto the motor was missing, nowhere to be found in the box. Followed the links in the product listing to speak to the seller and was taken to Holmes customer service webpage to submit a webform. I explained that I purchased the fan on Amazon and it arrived with a missing part and I would just like that part mailed to the address I provided. They responded the next day that part was in the mail and I received it in 7 business days. Fan was easy to assemble. The rear grill mounting nut was already screwed on so don't go looking for it in the box, look on the fan. Fan is very quiet and kicks up super strong winds! Louder wind noise at highest speed but no mechanical noise. Giving 5 stars because things happen, parts end up missing. The important thing to me is prompt customer service response and resolution if there is an issue and I got exactly that.

Title: The Perfect Travel Fan
Review Content: We took this fan on a quick beach trip, and it exceeded every expectation. It’s lightweight, portable, and incredibly versatile. The breeze it puts out is surprisingly strong for its size, and it runs so quietly you almost forget it’s on. It’s also fabulous for circulating air in small spaces—it really made a difference in keeping our condo comfortable. The internal battery was a huge plus—we didn’t have to worry about staying near an outlet.

Title: Bought 2 - Will be returning BOTH!
Review Content: I was so excited to get these fans. I use a really large fan at night so wanted a smaller one to just circulate some air during the day & I loved the facts they have remotes & I could easily take them on trips. Plugged the 1st one in, lights came on & it would beep when clicking the button on the fan or remote but no motor noise & blades didn't even try to move. I thought I must be doing something wrong. Finally plugged the second one in after trying everything I could think of with 1st one & never got it to run. The 2nd one came right on so I know I wasn't the issue with the 1st one. Although it did come on, I'm also returning the 2nd one bc it makes a clicking noise. Like when we were young and would put a card on our bicycle tires, it's like that sound. Even though it ran that sound does not give me confidence in it's durability or longevity. Another important thing you should know is the remote has to be pointed DIRECTLY at the base of the fan so if you set it on the floor say at the end of your bed you will have to position yourself to point the remote DIRECTLY at the base for it to work. Also the actual fan part is very cheap. I understand it's to make it light weight but I feel like they could have made the plastic a little more durable without adding too much weight. If traveling with it I would suggest keeping it the box to protect it bc any kinda weight on it will likely break it. I will say, it does move around a good amount of air. I had it approx 10-12' from me & had no problem feeling it. I just don't think it would last long even never moving it but I'd certainly be leery of traveling with it due to it getting broke. Near $30 is alot of money to spend on 1 fan so I definitely want my monies worth & unfortunately these fans are worth about 1/2 of what I paid for them. I'll keep searching.

Title: I LOVE this fan!!!!
Review Content: This fan is amazing!! I used it for a missions trip to Honduras. We did not have air conditioning where I was staying. I would not have survived the nights without this fan! It does take a good amount of time to charge, but I charged it during the day. I used it overnight on medium and it only died 2 times in the middle of the night. Both were my fault because I didn't fully charge it either day. It is very powerful for its' size. I love that is folds up so small to fit in a suitcase. Also, you can do a lot of different angles. I did have a couple days I had a little trouble folding it up perfectly and snapping it in to place. Also, my friend bought the same one and it got knocked over the day we got there and it broke. She didn't even get to use it at all. The fan blade broke off, but there was no way to open it to reattach. I tried to break a few piece off to reach in, but I still couldn't get it back on. Overall, we will be ordering more!

I love having the remote and the different levels the only issue was having to get up to change the level of the fan but it wasn't a huge deal since it is meant to be for travel anyway but fast forward about 6 months and it can't be on any level other than low without dying or making this awful clicking noise, fast forward another few months and it turns on and immediately dies. I took it apart to see if it were salvageable and without changing some of the electronics inside it was not.

Title: Poor fan oscillation
Review Content: I purchased this fan last year in preparation for hurricane season in Florida. The overall performance was pretty good; the 4 different fan speed settings are great! It was able to run for around 8 hours on the first setting and the air flow is ok. However, I was disappointed with the oscillation. Most of the time it doesn’t move and, if it does move, it’s very jerky and pauses a lot. I was expecting a smooth glide. Because that was a feature I specifically looked for and was disappointed, I’m rating it a 3.

Title: Ineffective and Fragile
Review Content: I bought this fan to replace one I had in my room that was breaking down on me. I was unsettled that it was only as small around as the diameter of a basketball and disappointed that it wasn't moving as much air as I liked.Unfortunately the problems didn't stop there. I accidentally broke the charger that plugs into the fan when walking around it because I was treating it like a fan that had a normal plug cord and stepped too close to it by accident.Thankfully I had an additional charging cable that could fit into the fan's port but that was the beginning of the end.Eventually it stopped staying charged and it's now completely unable to charge up again properly. Three months is an unsatisfactorily short lifespan for a product such as this, so I'm happy that it got me through summer but I'm disappointed that it's basically trash now.The only circumstances I can see this fan being useful are if you need a device that's light to carry, you need to move it around frequently, and it can circulate the air in a small amount of space for an hour or two, like a storage shed or something. Just be careful not to damage the charging cable while it's plugged in or look for a bigger, better fan if this sounds like it doesn't suit your needs like it didn't for me.

Title: Great Fan for a Cruise
Review Content: This fan was purchased for a cruise as it has a USB connection for charging and the electrician passed it as safe for use on their cruise ship (Disney). It was very quiet and the battery lasted all night on the lowest setting, perfect for a breeze whilst sat on the balcony and sleeping. It charged fairly quickly as well.  Only disadvantage was it was a bit wobbly whilst sat on carpet and easily fell over, nothing that a bit of ingenuity and a few bungee cords fixed.

Title: So portable!
Review Content: I needed a small fan that I could adjust the height of, and this is perfect. It folds very compactly, and the remote can be tucked inside so it doesn't get lost. Now, that feature could be better: you have to arrange the remote just right in the gap where the post folds in, but it will work if you are careful. A better place for the remote would be awsome. The battery lasted a long time, and I could work the button with my foot. I took this with me to work in my storage unit on a hot day, and it cooled me down during my breaks. It isn't room size, for sure, but is a perfect size for one person to set up to blow right on them. I will be using it when I walk on the treadmill.

Title: Rechargeable portable fan
Review Content: I absolutely LOVE this fan!!! My development is older and prone to electrical outages during storms and I happened to see someone on TV at a NASCAR race have one of the fans in the bleachers on a hot day! So I ordered two and they are a lifesaver!!! Don't let the size fool you. They are great 👍. I can't say enough nice about them. I charged them up the day I got them and we had a horrible storm that evening. Power went out and It was getting stuffy. Turned on one fan and OMG what a difference!!! I was comfortable!!? I used it in the bedroom that evening because it was a long power outage and I am so happy I have them. I'm actually going to buy more of them for me and to give as gifts. Such a lifesaver!!!!!!!!!!!

Title: Perfect Fan
Review Content: I really love this fan.  I bought the 7.5".  It is extremely lightweight and super convenient.  A friend told me about it after she bought one.  It is probably one of the best buys I have ever made.  Reason I feel that way?I am a person who is usually overly hot temperature wise.  I need that little movement of air that keeps me cooled down.  This fan is designed to run without needing a plug in or battery so I can literally position it in any space...I now run it all night long in my bedroom at full height on low, during the day I use it in my living room and/or kitchen...it really saves on having my air conditioning on all the time.  I think is would be lovely to have on a camping trip.  It is perfect.  I will probably buy more - another for myself and others for family members.  Do not hesitate to try.

Title: Single best vacation purchase
Review Content: We went to Cancun for a week, they are in a heat wave at the moment and either our resort just lost power a few times or the city may have had a few blackouts. Either way, even when the power was on, it was hot. Like the sun chasing Mario on that one super mario level from when I was a kid hot. I bought two of these and we used them in our room at night, we took them to the buffet in the mornings with us, and we had them by the pool. I probably had 50 or more people, from guests to employees asking me where I got the fans.They pack up small enough to throw in a backpack or beach bag, they hold a charge really well but also will run the entire day if you just connect them to a portable charging brick. We didn't use the remote much but we did use the oscillating function all the time. I was worried the 8 inch wouldn't provide much air/circulation (I couldn't get the larger fan to the house in time for our vacation so I braved the 8 inch). I shouldn't have worried at all, this fan is shockingly powerful especially for how small it is. Sometimes it sat on our table, at night we raised it to its full height, when we had a palapa/cabana it sat on the "bed" with us and two wiggly kiddos didn't even knock them over.I seriously feel like amazon should pay me for how much I advertised this fan while we were out it was PERFECT. If I'm traveling to a tropical environment or camping I will definitely have one of these with me. My husband is even considering changing his bedside fan over to one of these.

Title: Great fan! Worth getting.

But I wanted to share that I’m really impressed with this fan and when it is fully charged and you use it unplug. It actually lasts a long time on the low setting. Higher setting you to expect to need to plug back in but it still lasts long. Long enough if there were a temp power outage. I like the size can easily travel and take it anywhere in your travel backpack or carry on. I have it in different places in my room easy to transport and stable. Only thing is I wish it came with a wall plug. I had to get that separate but the usb is universal that it comes with it. Wish that cord was longer too but you can replace with a longer one. The other only downside is the higher the setting is the louder it is. But it is otherwise a nice quiet strong fan. I still gave it 5 stars because of compactness and sturdy niece. And how convenient it is to have.

Title: A definite YES
Review Content: Bought this for traveling as I am one of those people that NEED that fan. I was going on a cruise and they were specific about what you could bring onboard. So I went on the hunt. This was my second purchase, the first style and brand didn’t work. I gave this one a shot. It was perfect in many ways. First the battery, doesn’t go all night but if you need it several hours unplugged it will do well. The cord was slightly too short but doesn’t detract from this being a fantastic buy. The air movement from this little guy was impressive. And surprisingly it isn’t loud, we could barely hear it.  Really enjoyed having the different speeds also. Bonus features: you can set it to different heights in a snap, tilt the head up and down and move the direction of air flow side to side.  When you are done, it folds up nice and neat and ready to use again the next time. The remote was handy too.  I feel like this was a great buy and will use it in all my travels. This is a 10 out of 10!

Title: AMAZING fan
Review Content: This fan is freakin' amazing! I've bought one for myself and two as gifts for others. The amount of wind power that this little thing manages to produce is a wonder. It's comparable to a traditional desk fan, not a portable fan--and better even than many of those!It folds up small enough to take with you when traveling. (Assuming you're checking luggage and portable cooling is important to you. I mean, it's not pocket sized.) I love that you can adjust the height and angle, so I can have it tilted towards me when I'm applying makeup in a muggy climate.I was pleasantly surprised how long the battery lasted and how quick it was to charge. (Though I do wish there was some indicator of battery life.) I didn't expect it to last long for the amount of oomph it has, but I had no problems. Also, you can run it while plugged in if you're gonna need it for awhile.As others have said, there's a cable but no wall adapter included. It uses a USB-A to micro-USB connector, so most likely any charger you have on hand with a standard USB port will work.The only down side is that it doesn't really function as a floor lamp as advertised, at least where I tried it on carpet. It immediatly tipped over.Seriously though, I love this fan.

Title: Fan does not include the Charger
Review Content: I purchased the 10000mAh fan. Not a bad little fan, but read on.When reading the information about the fan there was no mention of a charger.  Breaking down the word ASSUME comes to mind when I purchased this item.  Like others, I assumed that there would be a charger included.  I received the fan and found no charger in the box.  I called Customer support they placed me on hold and then stated I should have read the Question and Answer section.  How many people read the Q&A of a product I asked.  Most just read the ratings.  I did read the Q & A after the fact.It would be very advantageous for the seller and or Amazon to state that the charger Does Not come with the fan in the bold print within the description.  In the "About this Item", Recommend the Proper Charger.State the PROPER Voltage and Current of the Charger.  Within the tiny print in the pamphlet that came with the fan, it states Input voltage 5v, Input current 2 amps.  Not knowing the charging circuitry of this fan, I will stick with the 5V/2A charger and the 4-hour charging time stated.In Addition, this is a Lithium battery at a claimed 10000 mAh (milliampere hour ) which equates to 10 Ah (Ampere hour).  There have been issues with many cheaply made Chinese Lithium batteries,  you better be sure you purchase the proper charger.Using the Wrong charger may not properly charge the fan and could cause a shortened battery life or in the worst case, could be a disaster such as an explosion and or fire of the battery if not being charged properly.  The latter happened with a Chinese-made phone I had.  Where there's smoke there's fire.  Lucky I caught the smoke part first.  Another story, another day.One other issue.  States four (4) speed, not quite.  The rpm of speed 4 and speed 1 is the same.Good luck with your purchase.
Manually Corrected Title: Fan does not include the Charger
Manually Corrected Review Content: I purchased the 10000mAh fan. Not a bad little fan, but read on.When reading the information about the fan there was no mention of a charger.  Breaking down the word ASSUME comes to mind when I purchased this item.  Like others, I assumed that there would be a charger included.  I received the fan and found no charger in the box.  I called Customer support they placed me on hold and then stated I should have read the Question and Answer section.  How many people read the Q&A of a product I asked.  Most just read the ratings.  I did read the Q & A after the fact.It would be very advantageous for the seller and or Amazon to state that the charger Does Not come with the fan in the bold print within the description.  In the "About this Item", Recommend the Proper Charger.State the PROPER Voltage and Current of the Charger.  Within the tiny print in the pamphlet that came with the fan, it states Input voltage 5v, Input current 2 amps.  Not knowing the charging circuitry of this fan, I will stick with the 5V/2A charger and the 4-hour charging time stated.In Addition, this is a Lithium battery at a claimed 10000 mAh (milliampere hour ) which equates to 10 Ah (Ampere hour).  There have been issues with many cheaply made Chinese Lithium batteries,  you better be sure you purchase the proper charger.Using the Wrong charger may not properly charge the fan and could cause a shortened battery life or in the worst case, could be a disaster such as an explosion and or fire of the battery if not being charged properly.  The latter happened with a Chinese-made phone I had.  Where there's smoke there's fire.  Lucky I caught the smoke part first.  Another story, another day.One other issue.  States four (4) speed, not quite.  The rpm of speed 4 and speed 1 is the same.Good luck with your purchase.

Title: Great fan but battery sucks. Repair advice.
Review Content: So this fan is great minus the battery. I’ve owned it less than a year and it won’t hold a charge. I never travel with it so this wouldn’t normally be a problem except for the fact that it will shut off without a good battery. The issue is either due to crap batteries or a poor implementation of the ip5306. I suspect the latter.If you have the same issue, and you probably will, there is a white sticker on the bottom that looks like the plastic. It’s hiding four screws that will let you disassemble the fan (see pics). You can replace the battery with another 3.7v or move the 5v usb connector to where the battery was plugged in. This worked just fine without dropping the voltage.Edit: The higher voltage did cause some issues. I just didn’t notice right away. Use something like an LM2596 to drop the voltage to 3.7 and you’ll be fine. There are tons of them on Amazon.

Title: Tried two: Both stopped oscillating in 1-3 days.
Review Content: I sleep best when I have some air moving, and lately I spend a lot of time on the road. I was hoping to replace my broken standing fan with something that could do double duty at home and while traveling.Pros: quiet when operating, portable, remote is a nice option, nice “low” setting.Cons: both stopped oscillating, locking mechanism seems fragile.Additionally: Loud beep function could be a pro for someone who is hearing impaired. Stressful for someone sharing a space in the middle of the night.Full review:If you just want a telescoping travel fan, it has potential but feels fragile. If you are specifically looking for oscillating, I cannot recommend this.Products like these make me wonder about my impact as a consumer. Because I tried two and both needed to be returned for the same issue. Do they get re-tested? Go into a landfill? Harvested for cheap plastic parts? No clue. But here is what worked and didn’t work.The first one stopped oscillating in the middle of the night, waking me up overheating while the fan was pointed across the room and not turning back. I tried turning it on and off. I tried a reset at the base. Nothing.Sleep was frustrated.I ordered a replacement and that lasted two nights before it had a similar issue. I found that if I lifted the entire fan up, the base seems to loosen and the movement returned. I’m wondering if the weight of the fan being completely extended (floor standing vs desk standing) that maybe the weight causes something to stick after a while.Either way, I’m going to be returning the replacement and looking at either another brand or possibly into a camping fan and just waiting for the technology to become a little more robust.Unrelated to the movement issue, the beep made by the fan when using the remote is incredibly audible. I could see it being excellent for someone who is hearing impaired. But if you’re trying to troubleshoot at 2am it’s stressful worrying about waking your housemates.

Title: Exactly what was needed!
Review Content: This is the perfect fan!  With perfect customer support!  I bought this fan months ago, and, after every shower or bath, set it to run for an hour or so.  Running another electric outlet to my adobe (many-inches-thick walls and roof!) bathroom would have cost thousands.  This fan has worked very well, in terms of helping disperse the extra humidity.Yes, I had to charge it every week or so, but that was a small price to pay.  No mold on my north wall in winter with this fan and new anti-mold paint.  I could still see condensate on the wall, but this fan (set on high) seemed to dry that up fairly quickly.As for customer support--When the remote died, they actually came through!  Rather than having to buy a whole new fan, they sent me a new remote free of charge!  (I did try a new battery first, to no avail!)  And, the replacement remote works like the old one.So, I am very satisfied.  I'd pay a lot more to get something that would work reliably for many years without my having to intervene, but, that doesn't seem to be possible at the moment, with planned obsolescence, supply chain and other issues.  In any case, I've more than gotten my money's worth, and this business seems like a group of people who really do want to succeed, which I applaud.

Title: Brilliant!
Review Content: These are excellent! We've had two for about 18 months -- we use them every day. We're big fan lovers -- both for the cooling and for the white noise. These truly are wonderful. And the ability to collapse them down to take on a trip is priceless! And wait 'til you hear the ooing and aahhing when people see it for the first time! The remote is simple, but may take a little getting used to -- we don't use the time functionality, so just the power on/off button and the speed control button are all we need. A tip for those sensitive to light: the power on/charging light is a little on the bright side -- we've discovered that an eye glass cleaning cloth folded up into a square mostly blocks the light, but allows the remote control to work through it.Highly recommend!

Title: Possibly demon possessed, but actually a good little fan.
Review Content: Bought this after going through Hurricane Ian and being without power for 8 days. I want to be more prepared for the next time. At first, I thought I might need a crucifix, priest, and some holy water, as the fan started randomly changing speeds by itself. However, the next day I tried again and haven’t had any issues since. Actually a great little fan. I’ve been using it sporadically for 3 days now (on the lowest setting) and it’s still at 61% battery life. Has 3 speeds and a fourth setting where the speeds change at intervals. Has a small night light and has a rotating function. Overall, I actually love the fan. The beeps are a bit loud when you change speeds, but that’s my only major heartburn with it.

Title: Packs a powerful punch for a small portable unit and excellent customer service and follow up
Review Content: This portable floor fan  is powerful for its size. I like how it folds into itself for easy transporting. Battery life seems to be pretty good but I only use it on low because that is actually quite significant if it’s close enough. Got it for power outages but fortunately there were no major hurricanes here in North Florida, so I put it away until now in February months later. I took it camping on a weekend where we had one of our freak times when we have 30 degree differences within 24 hours. I brought a heater and this fan and actually needed both a day apart. Unfortunately the collar that tightens once the telescopic pole is raised broke only after a couple of previous uses.. Even though it’s been more than half a year, I sent a message to the seller to see if there was any work around or fix to this issue. After requesting photos of the problem, the sellers offered a bit of a cash refund for compensation. I actually thought that was very nice but reiterated I wanted to see if there was a part or an easy fix to the fan issue because I wanted to use it still without it folding back in on itself. They chose to send me a whole new product after this long of time. I was blown away. That’s customer service!!!

Title: Good travel fan
Review Content: Bought 2 of these for traveling because they are so compact, but I actually like using them around the house a few days a week; when doing house work or straightening my hair in the bathroom.On high, they last 5.5-6 hours. On medium around 13 hours. The output is pretty good. What you would expect for the small size. One remote will turn on both if they are close to each other, but usually they would be on separate night stands so doesn't cause an issue. One of the charging ports feels a bit deeper than the other. They both work fine right now, have had for a couple months. Hoping it doesn't eventually push in. If it does, I'll update. Only negative is the grate on the front is a bit flimsy, so you just have to be mindful of how you pick it up.

Review Content: This portable fan I was hesitant to order but I gave it a try.  This is sooooo quiet that I hardly know it is on.  It uses a "C" connection which is great.  I am glad that is starting to be the norm as it cuts out on all the different cords to plug something in.  I plan on purchasing a couple more in order to replace the bulky ones that soak up a lot of electricity just to run.Very good product.  The other nice thing is I can take it with me on trips when I visit family that live in the South where it gets HOT and MUGGY.

Title: Very handy and useful, surprisingly powerful portable fan!
Review Content: This is a powerful fan that is perfect for carrying around room to room for my needs. I recently also took it on a trip because I need airflow at night and the hotels would not have any fans. Fit nicely beside my clothes in the suitcase and the convenience of the remote makes it even for functional and pleasing. My only major complaint is that once it is fully telescoped out, the top is way heavier than the bottom and unless you have something heavy to hold down the base or something to prop the top up against, you cannot use it at its tallest setting. I’ve been able to work around this by placing it on furniture with varying heights while at its lowest height in order to get the airflow hitting me at just the right place

Title: No need to hunt for an outlet and it’s very breezy!
Review Content: This fan is awesome. The instructions don’t explain how to use the remote, which is how you set the timer, and there’s no display to tell you how much time you’re setting it for. I’m sure I could find the info online. The best best part is I can move it from room to room, put it where I need it and not plug it in.Even though it’s not a big fan it puts out a nice breeze even on low. I’m in a 2 bed apartment so it’s not like I need it to blow across a large living room. The ability to raise and lower it works too. The pole isn’t the heaviest I’ve soon but it works and that’s what I care about. Also realized today that it will fit neatly back into the compact box for stowing in the closet every Fall.

Title: Great fan! IMPORTANT ISSUE-please read!
Review Content: I love the portability of the fan and the remote is coming in more handy than I expected it to be. It also produces a good amount of air especially on high!IMPORTANT: The fan will collect dust just like every other fan, but when it does the fan blades will be moving but little to no air will be coming out. I thought it was broken until I looked closely to see that there was some dust build up in the fan cover.All I did was remove it, quite easily, and dusted it. It works like a charm now! I couldn't believe such a small amount of dust could cause it to stop working correctly, but it did.I think this fan is awesome!

They pack in a suitcase really well and I was able to use my cricut joy to label them because I’m extra. We used them at a pride event and got so many jealous looks. And the fact that it’s chargeable and doesn’t need batteries to be replaced by constantly using it is a huge bonus.

Title: Powerful for a little thing
Review Content: This little guy puts out some wind speed! We bought this for our camper for when we can't run the a.c.  Haven't made it camping with it yet but so far it works great for cooling down while getting ready in the morning. (Ladies you hear me, blow drying/curling/straightening is rough in the summer) It also came in handy when the power was out for 8+ hours in 90 degree weather! Im impressed with how tall it gets. For a while I was using it at half height because I didn't realize it got taller. I've attached pictures with our little cat for scale so you can see all of the different sizes. So far I've used it for about a week every morning and haven't had to charge it yet so the battery life is great! Overall I'm impressed with the amount of fan for the price.

Title: PERFECTION for working while sitting
Review Content: I do eyelash extensions & had a small table fan that I would sit on a chair next to me because I get very hot while working. It finally fell off too many times & died. This fan is perfection. I don't want a large fan to also blow on the client & blow my lashes around.  This fan sits at face level while I'm lashing & doesn't blow on the client at the same time. It's got a lot of power for how small it is & 3 or 4 levels (can't recall) so I can get the perfect level of power & direction while working. It's decent quality for the price & has been working great for the last week since I got it. I love it.

Title: Worth the Price- Used by PC Gamer
Review Content: Bought as a gift for husband. He's an avid gamer and very hot natured, so you can imagine a running PC makes it even hotter.He was using small USB portable fans, but they were weak. This telescopic fan works perfectly behind his monitor. It's set taller than the screen and tilted down to blow directly on him. He uses lowest and second setting to get longer run time, but it charges quick enough.You might ask why not get a regular plug-in-the-fan? Well, as with most electronics & small spaces cords are a nuisance & make neat spaces look cluttered. It also allows easy placement- floor, shelf, desk. And our cats can't chew on a non-existent chord. :)It was worth what I thought was a hefty price. Only thing that would have made this 110% is if it were available in black ;)

Title: 16" COMFORT ZONE DESKTOP OSCILLATING FAN
Review Content: The first one I received, the fan blade was broken but AMAZON'S great CUSTOMER SERVICE got right on it and replaced it without any hassle. The replacement was a breeze to put together. I liked that it had a metal grill and a carrying handle. I was replacing a fan manufactured by a different company bc the fan blade broke on it. This fan had been running great over the last 15+ years.  When I called the manufacturer, I was told that they didn't have a  replacement blade that would fit my old fan. This is the reason why I ordered the Comfort Zone.  I asked plenty of questions about how much air it would push/blow, ect., and thought I'd try it based on customer's answers and reviews. In the meantime, my daughter asked me if she could have my old fan, with the fan blade that was all duct taped together. Fortunately, I found a replacement fan blade for it right here on AMAZON and ordered it. I wasnt really happy with the Comfort Zone because I was very used to the wind power that my old fan could push/blow. On the #1 setting, it pushed more air than the Comfort Zone when I set it on #2 setting. After the replacement fan blade finally came in, I took over to my daughter's place and took out the broken fan blade (pathic looking thing) and put in the new one. After I put it back together, I set it on #3 and was amazed with the difference between both fans comparing wind power.  That was enough reason for me to decide to return the Comfort Zone. When my refund is processed, I'm definitely going to orderer the same type fan that I gave to my daughter from the manufacturer that made it. I shouldve purchased it from the very beginning, but I wanted a metal grill and my old fan had a plastic one. I just hope it lasts as long as my old fan has been going. It had 6 different settings so I could position it down, in the middle, up and anywhere in between. It also oscillated. I'm not sure if I'm supposed to mention the competitors name but whoever proofs my review before it's posted can remove it. I'm ordering the 16" desktop fan that oscillates manufactured by LASKO! It literally BLEW THE COMPETITOR'S COMFORT ZONE FAN that I ordered away!  After having the Comfort Zone fan running in my place when needed and then comparing to the LASKO that I gave to my daughter after replacing the broken blade, the difference was like night and day.

Username: All the Good Names are taken!
Title: Build it yourself and little air flow
Review Content: A bit of a pain to have to "build" your fan, but it is not too bad. I have no idea why companies think we like to manufacture our own products at home... but it is an increasingly apparent that labor is too much for these companies and it is better to make customers do it themselves than to pay people or buy bigger packaging.That said: the air flow is very meager. Much lower than any other fan of this type I have ever owned for sure. I really feel it should be better for something I had to put together! I suspect that companies save money further in returns because who wants to build a thing and ten take it apart to return it for "meager air flow".They won. I am keeping it because I can't be bothered to take it back apart to simply return it. I would not purchase it again (I foolishly purchased THREE, and put all of them together before testing them!). If you don't mind the labor, and only a little bit of air flow.. this might be for you.

Title: So far So Good
Review Content: I have to keep 20 fans going in a space that can't be air conditioned. There is a lot of white noise . These fans  are the most quiet I've found . They die after 2 or 3 years and must be replaced but they are better than the larger staionary non-revolving floor fans -- or tower fans for my particular needs. In general they will be fine for 3 years . Then they will start to make a racket and soon stop working.

Title: Works as expected but design & assembly is awfui
Review Content: This fan works fine, noise level is low but very dissatisfied with assembly.  The instructions depict that there is a slide clip to attach the front grate to the back grate, however the fan I received has eight tabs with front grate needs to be pushed behind these eight tabs on the back grate.  It seems the front crate is too big for the back great because it does not fit and I could not push it in to get the tabs behind it.  When I pushed harder to get them in, the grate failed so I now have broken metal sections so thankful I don’t have small children to worry about.The first picture shows these tabs that are different than those slide clips.The rest of the pictures show how the front grate is larger than the back grate and you can see where the grate tines have broken trying to push it it on the tabs.Hoping the seller has some solution to offer.

Title: Installing front grill is super difficult
Review Content: Let me start by saying I'm a heavy oscillating fan user. There must be 5 in my home. I regularly take them apart, wash the blades and grills and reassemble. I've seen many variations on securing the front grill - some are better than others, but I use them all without issue.The grill on this was nearly impossible to install.  Not joking, I used a shoe-horn to pry it into place. The front grill is metal, the plastic rear grill has tabs under which the front grill is supposed to snap. Well, snaps would be nice. This was more like jam it in, force it in, pry it in. I was this close to giving up when it suddenly did snap. So, ok, I need a new fan, this was $25, it's assembled now, so I'll keep it. But overall, I'd hope for a friendlier system for next time.Photo shows metal grill seated under the plastic tab as viewed from the front of the fan

Title: Great for about a year
Review Content: We really enjoyed everything about this fan from its size to its breeze and noise level. We bought it in late December of 22 and it just died yesterday, late September of 23. A few days ago it started making a squeaking noise while rotating and sure enough last night it smelled like the motor burned up & it quit. We did run it quite a bit, we are the people that sleep with a fan on & I often would leave it on during the day for the pets. It was great while I lasted, just wish it would have lasted longer.

Title: Better Than Negative Reviewers Say
Review Content: This is a fine oscillating fan. The base and rear piece are plastic, however this doesn't affect the output.  The breeze even on low is excellent.  Regarding the noise level, it is a large fan, and it sounds just like you would expect a fan to sound - like a fan.  For the money, it is a fine fan, and it gives a good breeze  - like a large fan should.  And it's easy to assemble.  The one criticism is that the carrying handle is an indentation on the back plastic panel, and it has sharp edges.  They should sand them down, but I can do that.  There are not a lot of choices in this price range for a white fan, so I went with it, and I'm satisfied.

Title: Good basic strong fan
Review Content: I own two of these fans now. I had a fan for 15+ years and the poor thing finally died. I already had one of these and decided to get a matching one. It’s your basic rotating short fan. Nothing fancy, but if you want something you can put on the floor or a table to move some air, this is it.  It’s a bit louder than my old fan, but much quieter than the loud wall AC unit I have. It’s nice if you like a bit of white noise when you sleep.The only real negative I give it is trying to get the base and trunk together. Both times I scraped my knuckles trying to pop the pieces together. Yes I want a sturdy fan stand, but I having to lay my body weight onto it on the couch to get it in is extreme. Or maybe I am just a weakling.Would buy again if I bought a larger place with more rooms.

Title: Too loud and strong
Review Content: I bought this fan to replace a bedroom fan, but unfortunately this one is a little too loud to sleep to, so we had to switch it out with another one from somewhere else in the house. Wouldn't normally be a problem, except for the fact that this one, even on the "low" setting, blows  too much air for my liking. I've had many fans, and have never seen one on low blow this much air. If you like that, I guess you're golden - but it's too much for me. It reminds me of my warehouse days when we had big industrial fans moving air around. Other than those two things, it goes together fairly easily (although it's REALLY hard getting the front grill snapped into the back grill), and it tilts and oscillates fine. I wouldn't buy another one.

Title: Nice little fan that is well-balanced and works very well.
Review Content: I have hyperhidrosis mostly on the head and upper body. For those not familiar with this disorder is simply means the individuals internal temperature controls don't always work as they should. And that means you need to keep a fan so that you can quickly cool the affected area, and that means even during the winter months. That's why this fan was selected and I'm really glad I did. This is much like most fans of this size but having had some experience with this vendor I knew this would be another good product. Three speeds means you can control the airflow in an office, bedroom or even the garage without having to resort to the more forceful air-conditioner. For those who don't have a problem with sweating or internal temperature control, this fan is as good as anything I've ever used before. The base is sufficiently large to help the fan maintain its position, and I think the weight is balanced well enough toward the base to help offset torque from the blade. I've used this fan for about three months now and can report that it is as good, if not better, than any that I've owned before.

Title: Simple product. Exactly what is described. I do recommend.
Review Content: 6/1/2020:Easy to assemble.Sturdy construction.The polarized plug has a fuse (most fans these days have that).Fan runs smooth and quite (yes there is noise, it is a fan).Got one for my 5yr old's room and one for my bedroom.  Good balance between noise and air movement.  Much quieter than the 30-inch lasko box fan (which I also recommend if you like to put a fan in the window).I have never purchased a table top fan like this before and I was pleased to see they are similar to those my parents and grandparents had in the 90s.  Although the plastic on this model is not as rough-and-tough.  That might be good, the plastic seems more playable so probably less brittle and less likely to chip if dropped.I'll report back if I have issues.  As of now I fully recommend.

Title: Great fan
Review Content: This is a great fan at a very low price point. Yes it is all plastic except for the outer blade guard and that blade guard is a little difficult to install. But I'm confident my grandchildren will not be able to remove it. I've been using it for weeks now and no problems at all. And believe me, it can move some air!  Update: It's been a year since I purchased this fan. (Almost to the day) Today the blades quit turning and so fan is shot. No lube holes, so I'm going to start looking for a replacement. Worked great for a year and worked ALL year.

Title: OK Fan
Review Content: I bought this fan for the bedroom. It is not too noisy with a pleasant hum. It was not too difficult to assemble except for the front grill, which was next to impossible to attach. Getting it off to clean the blades will be very difficult. There has to be a better way to attach it.  The blades are thin plastic but they put out a reasonable amount of air. It seems overall pretty sturdy.

Title: Replacing 10-year old same center-swivel Lasko - Awesome #4916 product!
Review Content: First, I was replacing the former model of this very make/shape/design of fan from almost a decade ago. Shape = the top half can be moved left or right and blows a different direction than the bottom, where it always seems like it covers far more blow-area than you might ever imagine for my old 14" fan. My old model only difference to this 4916 model I now confirm was only old one a turnie-knob to select speed/oscillate, rather than this new one with 2 push buttons.  Did I mention my old Lasko lasted 10 years?When I shopped here for a replacement, oh I looked at many brands, all cheaper really.  Good stuff, reviews were good. Some big name recognizable makes, some remotes, some even had the temperature showing on them lol.  I only need to know "I'm hot" or "I'm not hot" - not a number, so that one makes me laff, but I digress again...So I shopped and shopped.  I found cheaper, but none had that center-swivel thing going for it.  Its a manual thing - nothing fancy, it just really reeeeeally widens the blow-area covered, and in a split-second reach you can adjust it anytime. Lasko was the only one that had it in the 14" like my old 14" size, so this I paid just a smidge more for, no remote, no bells whistles, two pushbuttons, manual swivel, same space it will take up standing on the table in the room I need it in.  If you have a small space to use this fan in, you won't believe how much difference that manual-twistie swivel option in the middle makes until you actually use one of these.I got model # 4916 black from this ad.  It arrived identical size as the one I got rid of.  That was still working fine, it just got that musty smell after 10 years is all.* Running, this new one is (the same) whisper quiet, in a tiny little echoey room.  The buttons don't "beep" like my tower fans - in the middle of the night - tG.  Had I got a different non-Lasko fan it might have beeped and for some reason I just don't like the ones that do that.  Unnecessary really.  The old one did not beep, the new one/this one does not beep.  It has no remote, but in a tiny room/on tabletop, ya gotta walk by it anyway.* What else matters, I think to self?  It matters that the Lasko fan I got rid of was a decade old, exact model except for knob to push button it turns out, and the old one lasted that long.  I could have saved a few measly single US dollars getting any other 14-inch-ish tall fan I found - with no pivot covering less blow-area - and taken 100% chance the fan wouldn't do ** exactly what I needed it to continue doing **, or I could get this one and hope for quiet, about the same item, and get 'er done as well.  And it did.  I win!I am so glad I thought it out and got this model 4916 Lasko. Shipping was predictable, reliable, packing was great, arrived in new/perfect condition as ordered, to tabletop and plug 'er in and manually swiveled the center of it, and within what was it less than 2 minutes my reliable Lasko was... back.I cannot speak for the 4911 shorter one.  It would have been too short for my same room area-coverage.  I cannot speak for the 4910 which is 14", but I chose the 4916 instead because I was hoping for the newest model available and getting another 10 years of great Lasko operation, where I can be happy to know:  In the future, save my time, just get the Lasko.  And now I know I can come back to this seller and get exactly what was promised.  Yay!

Title: Great fan w/2 adjustable units
Review Content: This is my second purchase of this fan. I love that it has two separate fan units, each of which can be independently adjusted in different directions. The fan has three speed settings (low, medium and high) and it can be set to oscillate or stand still. It’s hard to find good fans with these options. I gave this 4 stars as I think the price is reasonable, however, I had problems with the high setting on the first fan right from the start. It was unreasonably loud and vibrated  enough that I had to put a small piece of carpet under it. I had the first fan for 3 years, the motor was dying and would only run on the highest setting which was annoyingly loud. When it began to sound like a ‘78 Buick with a bad starter & COPD, I finally relented and bought a new one. I have been somewhat disappointed with Lasko about this fan not lasting longer & the problems right out of the gate. I would’ve requested a warranty for replacement, but life got busy. I like this fan’s features and though there are a couple similar ones I’ve tried, they’re not equal to this fan’s sturdiness and options. The carrying handle on the back is a nice addition. There is no remote.

Title: Extremely noisy, but effective. Avoid using Lasership no matter what you do
Review Content: Update #3: It's September now and this fan has gotten worse and worse and worse. Since it was too hot to return it - a terrible, noisy fan is better than none at all when it's 107F - I decided to see how long it would last.  I leave it running for days at a time, and it does run and the air it blows is fairly consistent.  It oscillates with no trouble.  But it's grown louder and louder, it grinds and vibrates even when not oscillating, and my entire desk thrums. I work with A/V and even with my studio cans on at full blast I can hear this fan on low from two feet away.There is zero excuse for this.  Lasko should be ashamed of themselves for this garbage.  I'm furious.Update #2:  It's 17 July and it's hotter than Hades in NYC, and I have had this fan running now since I the day I unpacked it and placed it on my desk.I am sad to say that this item is going to have to be returned, because it's gotten louder and louder and louder with each passing day.  It rattles and thumps and vibrates and makes so much noise I can hardly hear myself think.There is no excuse for this.  None at all.  I am extremely disappointed in Lasko.UPDATE:  I got the new fan yesterday (Sunday 30 June 2019) and it's much, much, much more quiet than the first one. As soon as I plugged the new one in and turned it on, I did a couple minutes' comparing the airflow (identical) and the noise (radically different) and put the first one in the box the second one came in, ready for return. I'm not even going to keep that first one for use elsewhere; the rattling and banging is not normal.That said, the fan is still noisy, just not as noisy as a jet engine being bounced round a room with metal walls. And it does not have a uniform noise quality, either - sometimes it thumps and bumps, sometimes it rattles, sometimes it vibrates heavily, and sometimes it operates smoothly. All of that is not ideal and should not be happening in a well made, quality fan, but here we are. Welcome to the state of the world in 2019.Still, since it's much quieter and the airflow is very good at the close range for which I will be using it (barely two feet from my body), I'm keeping it because it's too hot to futz around.  But when it comes time to replace it, I'll be spending just a little bit more and I'll order two or three different kinds to see which one works the best and doesnt make you deaf in the process.Do better, Lasko.  You are aware of these issues. There is zero reason for them to persist.  One star removed for ignoring known issues and very poor quality control.I generally like Lasko fans. So when the big heat hit this week and my health took a big nosedive, I decided that this summer I would have a desktop fan. After much comparing and contrasting, I chose this little guy, and for only the second time in my life took advantage of same-day delivery. If the heat wasnt making me quite ill, I'd have simply used Prime.First, let me tell you about the fan. Then I will tell you about the fiasco that ensued after I placed the order.The fan itself is a nice little sturdy unit, feels good and solid, well-made, and a small footprint.  The cord is long enough without being a nightmare.  The airflow on the top bit is good and strong on all three speeds, though it blows a very, very narrow column of air - much more narrow than the grates are, so that it has to be carefully aimed if kept stationary. Even a couple inches to one side or the other and you feel no airflow at all. The bottom portion is a much weaker airflow for some reason, which is a bit annoying. The top and bottom portions can be individually adjusted to whichever direction you choose. This is ideal for a hot desk: I can the upper portion of the fan blowing at my face, and the lower portion blowing at my hands on the keyboard as I work. It works out beautifully, and though it could be better, I am extremely pleased with the arrangement.The real downside is the NOISE.I'm not usually bothered by fan noise very much; I understand that fans cannot be entirely silent and the white noise can be very soothing and help with focus and concentration. But this little guy isnt a shop fan and there's no reason for it to be as loud as it is.  This thing sounds like the love child of a lawnmower on bath salts and a crop-duster with engine trouble trying to escape after just having pulled a bank heist.  Holy bananas, this thing is LOUD.And to make matters worse, it's not even just a steady loud hum like a fan. It's a buzzy, high-pitched, whiny loud that varies and oscillates, sometimes higher, sometimes lower, sometimes not present at all. And then there's the rattling and the thumping and the vibrating the desk so that the pencils rattle.  What on earth is the deal with this thing?It really is very, very loud.  Loud. LOUD. So I'm going to see what the other one I ordered sounds like when it arrives tomorrow, and depending on which one is less strident, I will return the other.Which leads me to an explanation as to why my single same-day Friday order magically turned into two fans by Sunday night:A little while after I placed the order, I went to check status to see if it had been processed. That's when I noticed that the final shipper was Lasership, a company I'd never heard of. A quick google revealed that they are a horrible, horrible company who is continually in trouble for outright stealing packages right from pickup with no intention at all of delivering them, and marking them as delivered and insisting that it is the customer's fault they never got their package. A number of very major online businesses use these guys. My friend told me the story of what she repeatedly went through when she ordered her cat supplies through a major online pet retailer that uses/used Lasership and that she never got her deliveries from them and they always insisted the deliveries had been made when they had not.Sure enough, 9pm rolled around (the "will be delivered by" time) and no fan. 10:30 pm rolls around and I call Amazon. The dude on the phone was very pleasant and completely unsurprised that Lasership never sent me my package. At one point, his exact words were, "I would be shocked if it actually ever showed up."  So he patiently went through the process - he tried calling Lasership but it was "after their business hours" and nobody picked up. He talked to his management.  He checked this and that.  Long story short, Amazon made good and at around 10:55pm, we hung up. I had a credit for a new fan which I used immediately and placed the order again for the same fan, to be delivered via Prime for Sunday (tomorrow), and my same-day shipping fee was refunded. Thank you, Logan!At 11:01 pm, I get a notification on my phone from Amazon:  My package has been delivered. Mysteriously at 59 minutes before midnight, six minutes after I get off a 20-minute complaint call to Amazon.  Suddenly, this box appears in my building's lobby.  I dont think so.Why is Amazon doing business with this company?  Why?  Why are they contracting their package delivery services to a company that has worse customer satisfaction ratings that Somali pirates?  What is wrong with you, Jeff Bezos?  Stop using these nasty tactics and treat your employees better!If I were the kind of people Amazon execs and Lasership are, I'd have remained completely silent about all of this and simply claimed that I never received the first fan at all. But I'm not like that.  So I'll check to see which fan is better and return the other.  Heck, I might even keep 'em both just to use the other in another location where the noise won't matter quite as much. I do work with A/V so I can't have a lot of extra noise while I'm at my desk trying to get my job done.Stay away from same-day delivery from Amazon unless you are absolutely sure that their last-stage delivery is covered by a reputable company.  Or Somali pirates.  Because otherwise, you'll be chasing your package from here to eternity, and you'll be hot while you do it.

Title: Great product

Title: Does the job and then some.
Review Content: We've found this summer that the ole AC is having a hard time keeping up with the heat.  So the better half wanted something small and that could be aimed at her while she's working at her computer desk.I did a little bit of looking and saw this, and figured we'd give it a try.  We've used Lasko products throughout the years and they deliver.So far it's not to shabby, as others have said the high setting does give out a bit of noise, but realistically to us its the only setting she likes, well, maybe the middle speed.  The low speed, doesn't seem to push out much air at all.  We've found that we like it all together, meaning the top piece facing the same direction for the best air flow.The cats seem to like it as well.  The better half likes it, and that's really all that matter.  I can't attest to durability or the like, till we've had it a bit longer.  I have two standing lasko's now that we still use and we've had those for years.  They still do the job well.

The low speed, doesn't seem to push out much air at all.  We've found that we like it all together, meaning the top piece facing the same direction for the best air flow.The cats seem to like it as well.  The better half likes it, and that's really all that matter.  I can't attest to durability or the like, till we've had it a bit longer.  I have two standing lasko's now that we still use and we've had those for years.  They still do the job well.

Title: Versatile, Space-Saving, But A Tad Weak
Review Content: Purchased for use as a bedside fan to provide a cool breeze and background noise.Pros:-Vertical design makes it SUPER easy to place on smaller surfaces/tables. I specifically bought this because I had a smaller nightstand and my other fan was just too bulky.-Fans can be adjusted to blow in different directions - meaning I could consistently have one pointed to my face and the other to my body, without having to use oscillating mode.-CRAZY QUIET - which technically doesn't help me as I wanted some background noise, but still it's impressively quiet.-Pretty durable - I have a toddler who has sent this thing flying to the floor several times and it barely even left a mark.Cons:-Buttons are inlaid to the base and reaching over and fiddling with them is sometimes annoying as you have to press decently firm to get it to register.-Buttons are used to adjust speed, so if I want it on low, I have to press power three times, as opposed to moving a dial with most other fans-Fan doesn't put out as much air as I would like for my purposes. I imagine as a desk fan in an office, this would be perfect, but for a bedroom fan, it just doesn't reach to the end of the bed.

Title: Absolutely Love It!!!
Review Content: I am in love with this fan! My supervisor had bought some of these for our workspace, and I got attached to them so much, I decided to get one for myself at home. I am very hot natured and love fans. This fan is small enough to easily take it from room to room without a hassle. It has a easy carrying handle on the back.  I love that you can twist the tower and make the top and bottom fan either blow in the same direction or in two different directions. It has 3 speeds which I love! It also has oscillating option. I can easily use this anywhere I am in the house to keep me cool and comfortable. I keep telling myself I need to buy more so I can have one in different rooms, so I don't have to carry it with me everywhere. It is very light so it's not heavy or troubling to carry with me. I would give this fan 15/10!!! I would recommend this fan to anyone!
