Title: Awesome little fan!
Review Content: I bought this for use in the hospital when I was a patient, with the intention of using it in a baby's room after that in order to help with airflow (which cuts down on the risk of SIDS) and to provide some white noise for her.  It is a perfect size to use on a bedside table.  I love how you can position the fan in two directions since the top and bottom swivel independently.  It helps cover more area with breeze.  There are two buttons on the front, one to control air speed/on/off and one for oscillation/stationary.  The only two negatives are the lack of separate buttons for air speed/on/off.  You have to push one button for all three speeds and punch it three times to turn the fan off.  Kind of annoying when holding a squirmy baby or if you have the fan on the ground and want to turn the fan off with your toe instead of bending over (yeah, call me lazy, but I am sure you would do the same thing if you put the fan on the floor.)  The second con is the fan has gotten louder the more we use it.  It is on for approximately 12 hours a night in my daughter's room, so it gets a good amount of use, maybe that is why it is getting noisier faster than normal.  It does provide good white noise, which is perfect for our intended use, so if you want something quiet this wouldn't be the fan for you.  If it had separate buttons for speed and on/off, it would be the perfect compact fan.

Title: It’s small enough to have a spot on the desk.
Review Content: It’s cute and is about the size of a desk lamp. It doesn’t take much space.What was misleading is that the top half remains stationary during oscillation. I didn’t see the description mention that it doesn’t have the ability to oscillate separate from the bottom half. I was under the impression, from the pictures, that it was able to move in the opposite direction while in motion with the bottom half.It’s not LOUD and annoying but even though you can still hear it, it’s not too noisy where it’s distracting while taking calls.The power button controls the three different speeds with each depression. The oscillate button only has the one function.The airflow is decent but isn’t very strong at the highest speed. If you’re someone that needs to have your hair whipping in the wind, then this may not be the fan for you.Since I live in the desert & the office is the hottest room in the house, then we’ll see how it fares when temperatures are in the hundreds. I might just have to update this review if it doesn’t do the trick.**UPDATE** I changed my 3 ⭐️ to 1 since I’m having to fan shop again. It worked just fine in the HOT summer but I’m VERY disappointed that this new fan only lasted a few months. I’ve had it for almost a year now, but by September, it was no longer working. I only used it when I’d work and for $30, I expected this to give me at least a year. Instead, I only got (maybe) 4 months out of it. I usually like Lasko fans, in fact, most of the ones I have is Lasko. With this one not making it to 6 months of good use, I’ve started to question purchasing any more of their products. Btw, I tried to “troubleshoot” and there’s just no fixing a dead fan. SMH

Title: This is well worth the money!!
Review Content: My little desk fan that I'd had for 11 yrs. finally bit the dust and I needed to replace it.  I really liked my other fan so finding a replacement hasn't been easy.  I've gone to several stores but none of them really had what I wanted so I decided to shop online to try to find one so I go to my favorite store, Amazon, and I found the perfect replacement.This little fan is amazing.  The airflow is really nice on every setting.  The high setting isn't so powerful so as to blow everything off your desk yet strong enough to cool one down quickly.  I really love the twist feature which makes it like having two fans in one.  My husband and I both do a lot on our computers and so our desks sit back to back so we can look at each other while we are on the computer.  With the twist function I have airflow on me and he has airflow on him too!  When I set it to oscillate it's even more amazing.  I really love this little fan!  It takes up very little room (less space than my old fan even) and is easy to turn on, set to oscillate and twist.  The price was fantastic and the shipping was free!  Does it get any better than all that? I don't think it does!  I couldn't be happier with my purchase and I am glad I found this fan.I recommend this anyone looking for a nice desk fan, this one is the one!

Title: Wonderful Fan!!!!
Review Content: This fan came in on time and there was no set-up required. It has two buttons on the front: Power button, and Oscillate button. It also has a rotating top so you can turn it in the direction you want it to go and it also has three speed settings. I did find that after a couple of months, it started to make a noise whenever I turned it on both the Oscillate and on the Low setting, but on Medium and High it didn't make the noise. Only when it is oscillating does it make the sound, so I hardly ever use that, or I just keep it on Medium or High. I would have given 5 stars, but didn't just because of the sound. It stands a little tall, about the same size as a 2-Liter Coke bottle and is a little bigger in width than one.Overall, this is a good fan. I loved how it had the 3 speeds, the low price, and that the top also rotates. The only negative I've found after owning this for a while now is that it makes a kind of motor, grinding sound when oscillating on Low. Other than that, I would still recommend this product for someone in need of a good, cool fan!

Title: Great Summer Helper

Title: EXCELLANT!!!
Review Content: While the air this blows is not as cool as some comments suggested, this is really an excellent product. I'm a semi-invalid. I rent a room in a private house, with access to bathroom and kitchen. The only time I've been out of the house in the last 3+ years has been to go to the hospital. This is the first summer I've been here in my room for a couple of years -- and 2016 has thus far been a REALLY hot NYC summer. I say that to explain how valuable this fan has been. I like the twist top. It allows one fan to blow on me, and the other on my aide. Also, this fan has been going 24/7 since it arrived. It's so quiet, I don't eve hear it when at my desk less than a meter away. I cannot recommend this product too highly. Oh, yeah... The price. As a senior citizen, living on a VERY limited budget, the price was a definite plus. Oh, one more thing: I RARELY make comments. Something has to REALLY be outstanding for me to do so. 'Nuff said. God bless.

Title: Lasko is selling an inferior product on Amazon than what they sold my company.

The exact same model they sold to my company is much better than this one.Do not buy. Knowing that Lasko operates this way means I will not buy any of their products again. This pile of garbage is going back for a refund.

Title: Compact size

Title: As Advertised--Noisy but Effective
Review Content: Well, it's as other reviewers have written: on high, this is one noisy little fan. I am keeping it, however, because it works really well. The medium and low settings are nearly noiseless, but high sounds a bit like someone is mowing outside your window...that sort of muffled but still-loud sound? Other than that, it's great--I LOVE that you can adjust the top to blow in another direction than what the bottom is doing. The oscillating option combined with the ability to swivel the top means it's possible to circulate the air in my otherwise deadly-still office and still keep a nice breeze on myself at all times. My office was stifling before, perfect temp now. Worth $27.99 any day! Just keep in mind that if you are expecting a larger fan based upon the way this looks, it's a "mini" tower fan--vaguely the height of a legal-size notebook and about that same width. Perfect for tucking into the corner of a desk, not perfect for sitting on the floor (unless you're trying to cool just your feet, which I would think odd...).

Title: I like this fan and I like the design behind it
Review Content: I like this fan and I like the design behind it.  I have two of them and they have served me well.  The main reason I have purchased these is that it allows me to have two distinct types of air flow.  I can have direct air pointed at one individual object/person or a breezy flow when I point the two fan heads in different directions.  When I want just a fresh feeling in my office or home I turn the heads as far away from each other and it creates a cool simulated breeze.  When I am really warm and just need direct air flow on me I can align both heads the same direction and provide relief.One thing about these fans though is that they are not all that quiet.  There are 3 speed levels and an oscillating function and all produce noise levels to where im not comfortable leaving the fan on while in a phone/meeting call.  Other than that great product and great fan!

Title: Amazing little fan!!
Review Content: I own two of these fans.  I purchased both in 2011 a couple of weeks apart.  I loved the first one so much that I purchased the second one.  I don't like the heat very much, so I use both of these 6-8 months steadily throughout the year.  That means we're talking A LOT of use over the past 6 years (I am writing this in July 2017).  I am buying a third one right now so I can have one in my office.  The two I currently own have been going strong with absolutely no issues.  I've never heard them creak, but then I don't use the oscillating function very often.  On the occasion that I do use it, no movement noise.  I use one while sleeping which is steadily aimed right on me, so no oscillating, and it's quiet enough to get a good night's sleep.  Just regular fan noise but not too loud.  It has three settings on it for how strong you want it to blow.  It's not very large but it sure does do the job!  I highly recommend this product!

Title: Died after 1 year
Review Content: I really liked this fan and was sad to see it die. I bought it last June.. so it only lasted 1 year. I kept it on my night stand next to my bed. I had a bit of trouble with it on and off. As air stream strength goes it worked really well once I got used to the noise. Because I live in Arizona, dust is kind of an issue with all electronics. I would vacuum my fan every month. I even had my husband take it out to the garage and blow it out  with his air compressor a few times. About 8 months of continuous use it started to have issues. It sounded like one of the blades was off kilter and the fan only moved when we cleaned it. I rarely used the oscillating feature on this fan. When it got really noisy.. enough to keep me from falling asleep, or if it woke me up I would just turn it off. One day last month when I attempted to turn it back on, it sounded like it turned on but no longer pushed any air through and that was it. I have had other larger versions of lasko fans and they just don't seem to last. I have vornado flippi fans that are still going strong after 5 years so I can't recommend this product.

Title: Good Airflow, Not As Quiet As I Expected
Review Content: Overall, I like it, but it's noisier than I expected based on the other reviews. It's got a slight rattle/turbulence that can be annoying, even on the lowest setting. Sounds sort of like there's a single-propeller plane buzzing through the sky, but off in the distance.Still, set on low, it helps in the afternoons when the sun is coming in through the window and I need a little airflow to keep me awake. The low setting is a nice, gentle breeze that's enough to refresh without whipping papers off my desk.UPDATEHad to drop the rating to three stars because I can't take the rattle anymore. It seems to have gotten worse. I just e-mailed Lasko's producthelp@laskoproducts.com support desk to see if they can recommend a way to fix it without having to return it as defective. I'll update again when I see how their support handles things.SECOND UPDATESupport was very cool, had me return it to Amazon, who sent me a new one. New one is quieter and hasn't developed the rattle. Raised the review back up to 4 stars.

Title: Great fan....for a year..
Review Content: I absolutely love the design of this fan. I use it as a bedside fan because it is more vertical than wide and it has the ability to direct air at my face and my body with its two piece design. My only problem with it is after about 6-8 months, it starts to wear out and not work so well on low.  I blow and clean it out monthly to keep dust build up out.  After about a year, the thing seems to just wear out to the point that it is noisy and usually doesn’t have enough power to operate on medium or low. I’m guessing because it uses plastic bearings and that they just wear out. It’s great while it works!  But I don’t want to keep buying 4 of them once a year. My whole family uses them, so it gets costly.

Title: Design is everything.
Review Content: I obtained an old version of this fan (probably 10+ years old).  I loved it.  I wanted to clean it, so i broke it open (and it still worked!)  I threw the broken fan under the shower to wash off over 10 years of dust buildup (this is what teachers do best) and it still worked!  It finally died in it's over worked condition (age and broken is not an excuse in my house..do your job dammit)  .... it finally died after 2 years!  I used to move it (with its entire back chassis removed!) on a regular basis from my desk to the floor (i'm a floor sleeper).I can put it on a very crowed desk and I can have continuous coolness because there are 2 manually adjustable levels (my chest gets cooled, my head sweats momentarily, then then opposite happens; this is very effective for a desk fan. And..consider the super endurance of it.

Title: Very nice. Very cool.
Review Content: I spent way too much time reading reviews of all the small fans out there. Darn my maximizing ways!I was looking for couple things.1) Quiet. This was for the office and I don't want to bug my co-workers.2) Small. I value my desk space. I did not want a giant fan.3) Cool. Literally cool. Air had to be strong enough.. yet quiet.Happy to say, I am happy with this bad boy. It's not the smallest of fans, but being that it's black and my desk is black, it sits hidden right next to my monitor. It has 3 levels of strength. I get super hot, but the lowest setting is good enough for me, especially as it is the only setting that is decently quiet. Like any fan, you will hear it, but no one around me notices, its a quiet ambient noise. Also for whatever reason the breeze feels very cool. It's like having an A\C machine! :)If your requirements are similar to mine. Go for it.

Title: Powerful, moderately quiet desk fan.
Review Content: I work in Phoenix, Arizona and this little desk fan is a comfort! Even with the building AC on, just walking from the garage to my building means I work up a slight sweat (and I'm not THAT out of shape). When I get to work, I turn on the fan to medium or low (whisper quiet at low), and I just let it blow right at me while I boot up the computer and get situated. By the time, everything is powered up and logged on, this fan has cooled me down and provided circulated air in my office. I love it. It's quiet enough that no one hears it when I take a call, whether on speaker phone or with a handset...and that's with it blowing at me and presumably into the phone's receiver.I like the oscillating feature to circulate more air in the office. I highly recommend it for small office or room space. I'm in an approximate 15 ft x 15 ft space and it is sufficient.

Title: Cold but way too loud!  Do not recommend!
Review Content: I bought this as a replacement for my old tabletop fan. I loved my old one and really wanted another one just like it. However, they were sold out and no date in sight for new ones. I needed one fast bc where I sit gets very hot. So, I chose this one.I didn’t need a remote so I tossed it. The noise level is horrendous!!  It’s fine on the top level but ironically the slower the fan goes the louder it gets. When it’s on the lowest setting you might as well forget watching tv or holding a conversation with anyone.What kind of question is “warmth”?  Is a cooling fan for crying out loud!!  Lol. Are they asking does the motor get too warm?  That’s kind of odd to ask that instead of asking how cool the fan is. However, the fan does blow very cool!  Sometimes too cool but I can’t turn it down bc the motor is way too loud!  I’ll be throwing this in the garbage and buying the old one I used to have!!

Title: Works great, just what I was looking for
Review Content: Have had this fan in my cube at work for two months, 8 hours a day, 5 days a week.  Works great, just what I was looking for.  Its not silent, even on the lowest fan setting, but it is quiet, definitely not too loud for a quiet office setting.  No squeals or rattles, works great.  Blows a lot of air, even on the lowest setting.  Nice feature is being able to direct the two vent outputs independently, so I usually have one aimed at me and the other away from me, else its too much airflow.  Oscillating feature works fine, but I rarely use it.  Do note the product is slightly different than pictured.  The vents are a gray color, not matching black, and the buttons are a translucent plastic with opaque diagrams on them, the complete opposite of pictured.  Nothing functionally wrong, just visually different than pictured, but it doesn't bother me.  Its a fan, and it works.

Title: Nice little tower desktop fan
Review Content: Fans are always so hard to buy, especially online, because half of reviewers say the fan is extremely quiet, and the other half say the fans are ridiculously loud. I watched video reviews for this fan on Youtube because I came across that problem. The videos in my opinion show a fan that is quieter than most. When I tried it at home, it also seemed like a good, non-noisy fan. Ultimately, I find the fan fairly low on noise but it does depend on what setting you're on, and where you're at. At home, the middle setting seems much less quiet than at my office (where I use it), which can be dead silent at times. Overall, I'm happy with my purchase, love the gray color, that you can split the direction of air flow, and that it oscillates. It's hard to find small, desktop fans that oscillate. Haven't had a bad Lasko fan yet. 5 stars.

Title: Very functional
Review Content: This is a great compact fan that I've used many times over.  You can set the top part to an opposite angle of the bottom part and maximize the fan area once it's oscillating.  Or set them together to maximize the volume of air.  All the options (angle of fan, oscillation, speed) are able to be used at the same time.  It has three speeds and even at the highest one it's still pretty quiet.  Used it many times during the baby's nap. When I found this fan, I was looking for one of those ugly clip on fans - I'm so glad I found this first!  Check it over though - I picked the first one up at a store and because of it's minimal packing the plastic casing was broken.  It ended up being cheaper on Amazon anyway, and came through shipping unscathed.

Title: Great Buy.

I can tell you that I work in Maintainence and it is often hot as Hades in my office with active men coming in and out and the door never staying closed. Definitely a great purchase for a personal desk fan. I’m also on the phone like 90% of my day too. Doesn’t bother me at all. It’s a great price for a great product too. Title: No problems here
Review Content: I don't know what all the negative reviews are about, mine works great and I love it. No issues whatsoever and have had it a good six months and I use it in my bathroom that has no exhaust fan so this just helps circulate the air and does a fine job at that. The fact that it oscillates and twists for only $16-$19 you can't beat that. And for you people who are moaning you only got a year out of it, if your a smoker, how long did those two packs of cigarettes that cost the same last you? Seriously, let's put things into perspective here, shall we? Title: Works great for a cube
Review Content: I had one of the cheap fans that is just the traditional circle and it was okay but never that impressive. Now that I have this one I realize how terrible it was, I had to have that one on high all of the time and hardly felt any air movement. This one I have to have it on low because it moves that much more air. The power button works great, I just push it 3 times and I am on low. My only complaint is that the oscillating button is hard to push, well it is really not hard but you can't just push the button, you have to hold the fan in place and then push the button because the button is harder to push then the weight of the fan. Small issue not that big of a deal but the fan works great.

Title: Feels like a knock off
Review Content: So, we got this to replace an identical one from several years ago,  the controls finally died after years of faithful service.  It arrived yesterday,  and while everything seems to work fine, there are a lot of subtle fit and finish things that just feel way chintzier than the older unit.  For instance,  the box was a hair too small for the fan, causing the top to be bowed up.  I found a loose machine screw and nut inside the package (lord knows where it came from,  because I've had this model apart and this screw doesn't go to the fan).  The non slip feet on the bottom are not a consistent thickness nor were they assembled in the correct spots, plus the original manufacturer label from the older unit is professional and clean, but the label on this new one is pretty crappy.Fortunately I sprung for the $4 for the 4 year insurance on it, so if it does, we can just get it replaced.

Title: ... these fans now and I can honestly say I love them. Due to living in an apartment with ...
Review Content: I have two of these fans now and I can honestly say I love them. Due to living in an apartment with some pretty crappy AC and not being used to the hotter climate where I live now I rely heavily on fans to keep me cool. I keep one of these one a nightstand in my room and one in the living room on my desk. Both of the fans I have are fairly quiet, not silent mind you but most of the sound comes from the air itself being pushed. It's small footprint means that it fits easily where I need it without requiring that I completely rework any spaces. I am knocking a star off because I do feel the design limits the airflow a bit. If the fan sits higher or lower than you do you'll have some issues noticing any airflow at all.

Title: Not Bad at All
Review Content: We got this to replace a small desktop fan that we keep on our desk because the room sometimes gets stuffy. This fan was much larger than we expected but was actually much quieter than we were expecting after seeing the size. This not a small fan and takes up quite a bit of space, but with the three speeds it is actually very adjustable and comfortable to use. We rarely use the oscillation feature and it seems to be limited to about 90 degrees of motion so take that into consideration. With the three speeds you can go from a stiff breeze felt 8 to 10 feet away on high to a mild soft breeze barely felt or heard from four feet away. All in all not to bad but it is rather large and might be more suitable for a kitchen or room fan than a desktop fan.

Title: Finally!  The perfect desk fan!
Review Content: I've been trying to find the perfect desk fan and I FINALLY found it!  I've tried fans that were way too loud and then those that were quiet enough, but didn't move any air.  Some of them even spattered a little oil from time to time - not good, especially when you're using the fan on your desk and you have papers lying about.  I didn't like handing my boss paperwork spattered with oil.  But this fan is perfect in my mind.  It has three speeds - the highest setting is a little loud for my office space, but the lowest setting is quiet and still moves a good amount of air.  The oscillating component just makes it all the better - although, because you can point the top and bottom parts in different directions, it covers most of my cube without oscillating.  I haven't seen a hint of oil either.  I haven't had the fan that long yet, but from what I've seen so far, I would highly recommend it!!

Title: Small, quiet and effective
Review Content: This is a nice little fan.  I have it on a table about six feet from my desk and on low it generates a nice little breeze so that I don't have to crank up the AC.  It oscillates effectively over a limited range and creates little background noise.  The top and bottom are slightly offset from each other, to increase the area being cooled. I even leave it on when I am in Zoom meetings because it doesn't add much ambient noise.  It's way quieter than the fan in my computer.  It's small, so it's not going to cool a room, but if it's just you in a reasonably sized  space, it works.

Title: It has worked well for six months of daily use and I would buy another if I had a need.
Review Content: I have used the fan on my desk in my hot office for six months, almost every single day.  The fan is quiet (a lot of fans I tried were louder or developed rattles), puts out a good amount of air and all features (three speeds and oscillation) work fine when selected although I always use it on high and have it pointed straight at me.  An earlier reviewer commented that the unit has specialized set screws which prevented the owner from opening the unit for cleaning dust.  That comment was accurate and I too hate a dusty fan, however, I found that a few blasts of canned compressed air (available on Amazon or in the electronics section of any big box store) did a good job of cleaning out the dust (just do it outside - lesson learned).  If I had another location where I needed a small sized but effective fan, I would buy this again.

Title: Not a durable Fan
Review Content: I am updating my review after a year of using this fan, my original review stays below. This fan has begun to not blow air, i.e. you turn it on and the wheels inside don't turn. Now with normal fans I would open it up, make sure everything is clean, and things would be great. This fani I can't do that. I also think that a fan should have a lifespan of more than a year. Would not purchase this fan nor this style again. And I use this in the office, where there is not a lot of dust nor are there any pets that have fur that can clog the fan. I suggest you pay a few more bucks and get a proper fan.Original Review: This fan moves a good bit of air, and the twisting function is interesting, if not very usable. However I bought this fan to use at the office where I feel the noise is too loud, I can hear the fan from a few desks away which to me is not very good. I would have a hard time getting to sleep if I had this fan in my bedroom. Also the buttons are not the most useful, you press the same button to turn the fan on, change the speeds, and turn the fan off, and if you don't hold the fan when  you press the button the fan slides across the desk. I don't hate the fan, but for my purposes, I would not buy again.

Title: Not sure if I just got a bad one or something
Review Content: * UPDATE *So about after a year, it started grinding/squealing and then just stopped working.  I opted to take it a part to try to clean it out and see if it would help, knowing it'd void my warranty.  It ended up working for a little while, then started again.I opted to email them, clearly indicating what I had done and that I knew I voided my warranty and that I wasn't asking for them to honor it.  I was just looking for some advice on something I might be able to do, to get it working longer than I had succeeded to do.  I promptly got a response back from them, giving me instructions on what to do and they would send me out another unit.NOT WHAT I WAS EXPECTING!  I thought for sure I was going to get a response back staying I voided my warranty and they would not honor it and blah blah blah.  At the very most I was hoping to get a response back stating maybe spraying it with WD-40 or something would fix it.  I was in no way expecting them to volunteer to still honor the warranty, after I blatantly admitted I voided it and was not looking for them to.  That to me shows GREAT custom service and is a company I'll continue to do business with!Also should note, this new one isn't as loud as my original one was neither.  So I believe it may have been a dud from the get go.  I mean, don't get me wrong.  It is still a noisy little machine, but not as noisy as my original one was.* ORIGINAL REVIEW - 3 STARS *Right now I'm on the fence for this.  Not sure if I just got a bad one or something, but it's really not what I expected.  I bought a larger, 184 model which encouraged me to get this.  This thing on it's top 2 settings is louder than the 184 on it's highest setting, which is 4-5x larger than this.  While speaking about it's size, it's a little larger than I thought it'd be (and yes, that's even with viewing pictures and reviews), which in some ways is a good thing and in others, not so much.  Does seem to put out quite a bit of air, almost comparable to the much larger 184, at least IMO.  Just definitely louder than I had thought and hoped it'd be.  Also kinda wish it had a remote.  Sure I'll be updating this in the future..

Title: Solid and simple.
Review Content: Works standing or flat.  Simple one button control.  No remote to lose.  No oscillating to fail.  I had both of these problems on the regular tower fan so now it work just like this Vornado unit ( On/off and level change only)  Air is very focused and not lossy across distance .  It's direct line powered so does not go through a power brick or require another power source like a USB one.  A bit more power hungry than the Sharper Image USB powered fan which only uses 1.5W to 2.5 W to run.  This one uses 21W at the lowest setting, then 30, 38, and 52W on the highest setting.  It move tons of air so no complaints there.  It's about 55 dB noise level at full blast down to 40 dB at lowest setting.  Not entirely noise free but not unpleasant at low settings.  Love squirrel cage fans for how well they work at moving directed air.  This is a great example of one to own.

A bit more power hungry than the Sharper Image USB powered fan which only uses 1.5W to 2.5 W to run.  This one uses 21W at the lowest setting, then 30, 38, and 52W on the highest setting.  It move tons of air so no complaints there.  It's about 55 dB noise level at full blast down to 40 dB at lowest setting.  Not entirely noise free but not unpleasant at low settings.  Love squirrel cage fans for how well they work at moving directed air.  This is a great example of one to own.

Title: I'm less impressed
Review Content: I bought a "Vornado 573 Compact Flat Panel Air Circulator Fan, 3 Speeds, Moves Air 60 Feet" and love it.  It has great power.> Initial disappointment with this was my fault.  I thought it oscilated, but it doesnt.  I think their marketing department is why I dont like marketing.  They arent client facing so they feel like they can say whatever they want.  This doesnt oscilate it is multi-directional.... which means you can stand it up or lay it down or reposition it manually as you choose.  OK.. I can get over that.  No biggie.>Says it's quit and pushes air up to 50ft.  My other says 60 feet and that throws a lot of air.  This one with max fan @20' I could feel it, but barely.  Its not on the same level as the other.  I have this positioned on the window ledge just beyond my laptop.  I'm 2' away.  On level 1 it is quite and I can feel a gentle breeze.  level 2 - Throws noticably better air and is noticably nosier.  level 3 - Throws more air than level 2, but noise level is relatively higher than the level of increased airflow.  Level 4 is noisy.>Directionally, the graphics for this fan show equal air coming out across the length of the blades.  That isnt my experience.  The bottom 2" most of the air flow seems to come from the middle of the blade area and seems exactly like my old tower fan.I got my old tower fan 3 years ago at Costco in a 2-pack for either $19 or $29 for a 2 pack.  I paid $40 for this ONLY because it is a Vornado and i'm extremely happy with my other Vornado.Would I buy it again knowing what I know.  Nope.Will I return it - Probably not.  it has been blazing hot this past week and the pain in the ass of looking for another fan isnt worth it.I liked the old fan better.  It was also a similar sized tower fan.  It was 3 speeds with a timer and ocilation.  I think it moved as much air.  This feels expensive for what it is.  The old one lasted 3 years.  I hope this one lasts.

Title: Works for me as a bedside fan
Review Content: The only thing I miss from my old fan which broke was the oscillation (this one does not oscillate, nor is it advertised as such). However, it is a little quieter (not the quietest fan but no problem on the lowest setting which I use while sleeping. Gets the job done. I can sleep with it at my bedside and the slight breeze of the lowest setting keeps me cool in the warmer summer nights. I use it standing up like a tower myself.

Title: Cannot use because of the higher pitched motor hum/coil whine.
Review Content: Size is great but the build quality and motor are BAD. Moves air in a focused way that's actually perfect for a little desk fan, problem is on settings 2-4 there's a loud motor hum. It sounds almost exactly like really bad coil whine. Anyone that has had a computer with a low grade power supply or any modern large video card would know and hate this sound.If you have any sort of sound sensitivity or just hate coil whine stay far away. And! the plastic is bad, with poor tolerances that gives it a little wobble sound at setting 1. speed 2 is about the only setting that sounded ok/meh, but at that speed it doesn't move enough air for me.Sound Details: On speed 4(max) its at 175hz F3 note at a very annoying level 62db using a phone app, so grain of salt, but can say its far too loud to be on my desk or even across the room, and speed 3 its about 136 C#3, app was saying around 55db for that, Still not at all tolerable for me but I could see some people being ok with it. For reference the top E on a guitar is 82hz or E2 and the bottom E string(the higher sounding one) is at 330hz, E4 and still too loud for me with the fan about15 feet away across the room. The noise appears to be coming from the motor and sounds like bad electrical hum. Its not a pleasant white noise sound at all you expect from a fan, just grating.

Title: Back for another one!
Review Content: Now I’m mindful that people have reported some serious problems with this fan. So I’m holding my breath.  But really, I have liked the first one so well I have just ordered a second. Maybe it will turn out to be a bad decision. But right now I am hopeful.At high speed it lifts my window curtains from 10 feet away — and they are substantial, blackout curtains.  And it does make at noise at high speed but it’s not like being next to a vacuum cleaner or an aging bathroom exhaust fan. It’s barely noticeable and is inoffensive. It does not get in the way of conversations or, for me at least, sleep.I have it in the upright position and it is quite stable. But I have no problem believing those who report otherwise. There is little concern for quality control in factories these days.  I bet a lot of lemons make it into boxes.  I also wonder if some of the “unstable” units suffer from vibration which might be tamped  down with the application of self adhesive felt , protectors.  Probably worth a try.I particularly appreciate that this fan is effective when the windows are open as well as when the air conditioning is on. We have non-zoned central air conditioning and using this fan in our tv room allows us to keep our a/c warmer and still be cool in the room we’re sitting in. And of course when it’s a windows open day this fan creates a cooling breeze.The size of this fan makes it an unobtrusive presence in the room.  It doesn’t take up much space and because it can be used either in the vertical or horizontal position it  is easy to find a space for it.. I’m looking forward to  putting one in those kitchen to assist in those summer days when I simply can’t get out of turning in the oven!

Title: Good for a tight spot, but rattles after a few months.
Review Content: I have several different Vornado fans throughout the house.  Most are conventional fans.  They move a lot of air relative to the noise they make, which is why I am willing to pay a more for a Vornado over other brands.  This is the only tower fan that I own at the moment.  I've had it for over a year now and it runs continuously most of the time.I like the compact design.  it fits in a tight spot between my desk and the doorway to our office.  We have a fair amount of computer equipment and this little fan does a good job of discretely circulating air from the hallway into the room.  It's quiet on its lowest setting and tolerable on the next setting up.  The two higher speeds make the squirrel cage blower whine loudly enough that I never use those speeds.  Overall it's noisy for what I'd expect from a Vornado.  I know tower fans are generally this way, but I was hoping for better.I don't like the speed control.  My other Vornados use a mechanical switch to set the speed.  Some of them are plugged into smart outlets so that they can be setup to run when needed rather than all the time.  I would like to plug this one into the power strip that controls my computer equipment.  However, I can't do that because the electronic speed control always defaults to "off".  I see this in a lot of appliances lately and it's really irritating.  The controller should store its setting in serial flash or use a mechanical switch.Rattles.  Most fans have to deal with some vibration.  My other Vornado fans tend to be made of heavier plastic that helps dampen vibration fairly well.  This unit's shell is thinner plastic that easily rattles in response to the unbalanced blower.  The blower is missing a blade where they had to tighten the screw on the motor shaft.  There is a metal clip there to try to balance it out, but obviously balance is not a priority for this device.  The cause of the rattle is the balance, but source of the noise is a combination of things.  The upper bearing is held in a soft rubber bushing and the lower drive shaft is also isolated from the blower with a rubber dampener.  These help absorb some of this vibration, but the grease that they use in the bearings seems to dry up quickly.  Some white lithium grease mixed with some 90W gear oil tends to silence these cheap shaded-pole motors.  It works on the upper bearing, too and doesn't seem to bother the rubber.  Getting the rear bearing cup off of the motor is a pain, but it can be done without removing the blower by flexing it out of the way.  The other rattle source is the motor itself against the housing.  There are no fasteners holding it but some strategic bits of foam tape on the support points will stop it.Overall, I'm not sure it's worth paying the "Vornado premium" for this fan.  It doesn't seem to be much better than your typical fan of this size from Walmart.  The controller hasn't died yet like it has for some people.  If it does, I will probably hard-wire the speed to what I need so that I can have it turn on and off with my computer equipment.

Title: Disappointing noise-maker of a fan
Review Content: UPDATE: Vornado customer service confirmed the fan should not make these noises and offered a replacement unit as per the warranty. When I told them that I did not have confidence in this duo form any more, they were willing to send a round fan replacement unit of similar cost instead. 5-stars to Vornado customer service!  If you think this duo fan function is what you need, you can try it and have confidence that Vornado will make things right if you get a bad unit. I am leaving my original review and not changing my star rating for future purchasers.7/21/24: I ordered this fan with high hopes that it could be used to draw air in from my window and as a general air circulator in my apartment. Unfortunately, I have been disappointed fairly quickly. Straight out of the box, this fan was a disappointment in terms of noise, but that has only gotten worse over the past month. In the vertical position, the fan makes a grinding noise--just loud enough to really get on the nerves, and in the horizontal position it has woken me up several times by when it starts to make a whistle/flutey noise.I do not recommend this fan to anyone. I am past the return date, so will be contacting Vornado about a return or a fix.  In the meantime, I purchased a different Vornado fan that works great (533DC Energy Smart Small Air Circulator) and am happily using that instead of this useless thing.

Title: If you want full force, it is loud. If you want quiet, it's too soft.
Review Content: This fan is loud when you start it because it starts on the highest setting. I had specifically searched for "silent fan" on Amazon, so I'm disappointed by the noise. On the second level, the noise is tolerable (but you know... still exists...) and it only pushes air for about 5 feet. This fan does not oscillate so the use case for it is pretty slim. I wanted it for my office, under my desk, but it is too loud for that. And the lack of a remote means bending to turn it on/off or adjust the level. It would also be too loud near a TV if you are trying to hear your show. I don't know who this is for. Ultimately, it does not meet my need.

Title: LOUD BLOWER NOISE, but effective at pushing air across a big room
Review Content: It's a powerful little blower.  Moves air quite a long way - suitable for a large bedroom or living room.  Great for pushing the cool air away from your air conditioner unit so the whole room gets cooled instead of just the few feet near the A/C.  As an added bonus, it is quite slim and can be mounted vertically or horizontally to fit on top of a desk or between a pair of sculptures.  Just be sure to give it a couple of feet of clearance in front and behind to get good air circulation through the device.But it is loud.  As in, don't put it in the room where you watch TV kind of loud.  It's a constant sound, too, not like you would get from an oscillating fan.  It might keep you up at night if you put it where you sleep, but it will move the air across that room.This unit has no timer, no auto-off feature.  Simply three speeds and an off button.  Lowest speed is basically useless, middle speed might work for a smaller room, high speed is for larger spaces.  Medium and high speeds are both quite loud but in terms of circulating air consistently and constantly it is more effective than a traditional "propeller" style fan.

Title: Not a full room fan as listed
Review Content: I have had many different models of Vornado fans for years and love them — except for this one. You literally need to have it a foot or two away to feel the air movement. It also beeps everytime you turn it on/off or lower the speed. I'm not sure why you would ever use any of the three lower speeds, barely pushes any air on high. You also need to push the button four times to rotate through all the speeds before it will turn off — many times it will be on the lowest speed when I thought it was turned off, that's how weak it is. Horrible design, Vornano should not even sell these.

Title: Almost perfect - wish the controls could be silenced
Review Content: I bought three of these - one for my home office, one for work, and another for the bedside. It's a fantastic fan that moves a ton of air and is relatively quiet. My only gripe with it is the needlessly loud BEEP every time you change modes. Because of that, it doesn't' make a very good bedside fan if you happen to sleep next to someone who goes to bed before you do - it will most assuredly wake them up.I may try taking it apart to remove the offending beeping diode, but it would be perfect if not for this one small tidbit.

Title: I cant get enough of it. I'm a fan...
Review Content: Super functional, super flexable. Use it vertical or horizontal. I use it while sitting on the couch with it 15 feet away it feels like a summer breeze (on #1). It will not cool a room. It will give you a breeze that feels cool. My favorite I use it in the bedroom while sleeping on a summer night with it 7 feet away on #1. It keeps me from waking up in a pile of sweat. Told my sister to buy it. She fell in love. What a buy!Update: If you think your Vornado fan is getting noisy. Turn it upside down and lean it against a wall so it will stay vertical. Use a flashlight and look inside where the shaft of the fan goes into the white plastic bushing (near the buttons). Spray or squirt any oil of your choice (I used machine oil) into the white bushing. It needs to be upside down so the oil will migrate into the bushing. It is dead quiet now!  Dont over do it or the oil will get into the electronics.

Title: A Bit Noisy and Wobbly
Review Content: Although I gave it 4 stars, it's really a 3.5. I bought one 2 years ago for my nightstand and wanted a matching one on the other side. Hoped this one was little better. Nope--same as first. Reviewers were correct on noise and wobbling. On the last 2 low settings it seems to struggle with air output and the device almost wobbles. It is a bit noisy on upper settings. Not a deal-breaker for me bc it matches my other, has a sleek design and noise doesn't bother us bc we have a white noise machine that blocks it out. So although I am keeping it, I don't exactly recommend. But the Catch 22 is that there are not a lot of others this size at this price point that got good reviews either.

Title: Just Love this product
Review Content: First, I live in Las Vegas, and it has been very hot I was at my doctor's office and while I was waiting in the room for the doctor, I was feeling a great breeze, and I noticed this fan on the counter, so I took a picture and when I got home went to my computer and ordered one on amazon. I have it on my desk and it is the best thing go get one you will love it.

Title: Excellent fan.  4speeds, merely hum at lowest speed.
Review Content: Update:  its been a couple years now and still love this fan.  It's attractive,  quiet at lower speeds.  If you are on phone often but still want effective and quiet, this is it.  It also fits well under most monitors if placed horizontal.  It has proved to be long lasting and reliable.  I'd buy another one in a heartbeat.Original review: Bought this fan after watching some reviews.  I use this fan at work and very impressed with it. Some Plus’s:  4 fan speeds, the lowest speed is very quiet, merely a hum, easy to forget the fan is on except you can feel the cold air,  It is perfect if you are on the phone often and want the fan closeby.  I have owned a few desk fans before and this is the best one so far. Constantly amazed at the super cold air it puts out Even on the lowest speed.  I know this sounds crazy but it is almost as if it’s a mini ac.  I know there are a few cheaper options for 19.99 or 29.99 but  this one is definitely worth the price.  I’ve bought desk fans from other manufacturers in the past and they are okay at first but they started squeaking or making noise from vibrations.  I will update this review after a few months of use.  I would definitely recommend this Vornado desk fan as of right now.
Manually Corrected Title: Excellent fan.  4speeds, merely hum at lowest speed.
Manually Corrected Review Content: Update:  its been a couple years now and still love this fan.  It's attractive,  quiet at lower speeds.  If you are on phone often but still want effective and quiet, this is it.  It also fits well under most monitors if placed horizontal.  It has proved to be long lasting and reliable.  I'd buy another one in a heartbeat.Original review: Bought this fan after watching some reviews.  I use this fan at work and very impressed with it. Some Plus’s:  4 fan speeds, the lowest speed is very quiet, merely a hum, easy to forget the fan is on except you can feel the cold air,  It is perfect if you are on the phone often and want the fan closeby.  I have owned a few desk fans before and this is the best one so far. Constantly amazed at the super cold air it puts out Even on the lowest speed.  I know this sounds crazy but it is almost as if it’s a mini ac.  I know there are a few cheaper options for 19.99 or 29.99 but  this one is definitely worth the price.  I’ve bought desk fans from other manufacturers in the past and they are okay at first but they started squeaking or making noise from vibrations.  I will update this review after a few months of use.  I would definitely recommend this Vornado desk fan as of right now.

Title: Versatile footprint, directional focus, and speed choices
Review Content: I'm in my 2nd summer using this fan.  I also have a 12-in. compact propeller-type fan.  But, the directional focus provided by this compact cylindrical fan is much more versatile for placement, and its 4 speeds are a handy range.  Notably, only the top speed is somewhat noisy, but if needed, that's hardly a problem.  I particularly like that footprint versatility of this duo as a vertical mini-tower, as well as the low-profile horizontal position.  I don't tend to favor fans with remote control, so it's not important that this model is only manual control.  Finally, I was originally impressed by the Vornado 5-year warranty, which is uncommon among household fans of other brands.  Yep, I recommend this Vornado Duo Small Tower Circulator, for versatile use in tight locations.

Title: Decent fan for the money..
Review Content: This model is replacing my Vornado, Helix 2 model that finally stopped working after about two years. I hope this lasts longer. This model moves a good amount of air on the highest of four settings, but tends to be a bit noisy. The second lowest setting is good for the bedroom as it's not too loud. The fan can be used vertically , which is how I use it, or horizontally. My only regret is that I somehow thought that it oscillated as my old one did, but that's not the case. That part I do miss, but this one also capable of moving more air than the Helix 2. All in all, I am satisfied with the purchase.

Title: Good fan with one major flaw
Review Content: In general I love Vornado fans.  I have 2 of the standard models in my home.  So I decided to buy this small tower version for my office.  It is the perfect size and has 4 different speed settings.  The highest speed produces a steady white noise that I like.  The major issue is with the button that turns the fan on and moves through the various speeds.  It beeps each and every time.  If you want it on the highest speed when you turn it on, that's one beep.  Want to go to the lowest speed?  That's 3 more beeps.  And the beeping is fairly loud.  It is not conducive for any type of environment where that would be a problem.  When I am on a call at work and want to change the speed, everybody on the phone hears it.  I cannot for the life of me understand why they found it necessary to have this feature.  At the very least, it needs to be turned down.

Title: Works great, but not silent
Review Content: I use this in my airless classroom. No windows and no ventilation. The students and I were melting.  The motor on this fan is very quiet. It has a strange rattle somewhere on the inside. When I reposition it, the rattle will temporarily stop. It's not a deal-breaker, and it is worth the noise to not sit in a bucket of my own sweat all day at school.

Title: Powerful little fan
Review Content: I found this fan to put off an adequate amount of air for a small room. The room I use it in is roughly 8’x12’ and it circulates the air well on setting #2.It isn’t the quietest though. At higher speeds (which I rarely use) it is noisy. This keeps me from rating it higher.I like the design. It works standing or lying flat and I found that to be the greatest selling point for me. I do wish it had a remote but I am sure that would of drove up cost. To sum it up would I recommend it…hesitantly yes but their might be better fans out there for less money.

Title: Packs a punch when used near desk
Review Content: I love Vornado fans and have several of them. They're the only fans that truly cool down a west facing condo and circulate the air.Although this one isn't a full room fan, I'm impressed by how much cool air it puts out to an area of the room. I have it about 12 feet from my desk and does the trick.I enjoy the spacesaving footprint.Bought on sale knowing it won't cool an entire room, but enjoying that my desk area - while working remotely - feels comfortable with this on. It doesn't need to sit on the desk and blow things around to get a concentrated stream of cool to cold air. Would also work well on a nightstand for sleep, but a bit noisy on high for that. I enjoy the white noise though.

Title: Great little fan
Review Content: I wanted a smaller fan for my bedroom. I have other Vornado products and found their styling and quality to be the best. So I naturally looked at their products when it came to a smaller fan. I really like that it can stand up or lay on it's side. My only negative comment is that the air foil in the front does not move. It only points in one direction. So when it's in the standing position, and  you want air to blow the other direction it can be a pain to have to turn the fan in a sort of backwards position. When it's on it's side it blows in a general upward position. I had no problem with that at all. I would have given it the full 5 stars except for the air direction not being moveable.

Title: Perfect for Work
Review Content: Perfect for my desk at work.  I have a small interior office that routinely gets above 80 degrees, even in winter.  I needed a small fan I could stick under my desk or against a wall to keep air circulating but which wouldn't take up a lot of space.  This fan is perfect for that.  I do wish it would oscillate, but if I put it under my desk and point it at the corner, the air blows up and circulates throughout the room quite well (not enough to blow my papers around, but strong enough to get a nice breeze).  On its highest level it can be a bit noisy, but as its a white noise I don't find it distracting while I work (if anything it drowns out the obligatory office sounds that can sometimes be distracting).  All in all, a great product.

Title: No Remote

I was going to return it, but missed my window. Darn. I purchased a tall, votando, instead, with a remote control, which I like much better. In MY opinion, this is more for a workspace, on a desk nearby, or on a bookshelf near the desk, on a nightstand near a bed, etc. Also, someplace where you could REACH over and change the settings, not have to get up, since no remote included.

Title: Great for small space!
Review Content: My baby’s room is our renovated walk in closet (about 70sqft)It had been getting hot in here so I bought this fan to try it out.We put it on the top rack facing outward into the closet and after being on for about 30 minutes with the door slightly ajar, the room is already about 10 degrees cooler.Not sure how it would work on a larger space, but for a small space like this, it’s perfect! And it’s not too loud- actually the sound is very even (not choppy like a standing fan) so it’s more of a white noise. I think he will sleep better with it!

Title: Rattles badly
Review Content: Had we not discarded the packaging material inadvertently, this would have gone back for sure.On the plus side, it is good and moving air. The engineering is of the fan mechanism itself is clever.On the other hand:- The industrial engineering of this is such that it only works against a corner to the left while vertical, or to the right while horizontal. The purpose for the stage asymmetrical outer pice of plastic is a mystery to me both practically and aesthetically.- The rattles are really bad. The video I posted does not even do it justice. It basically just rattles on any speed for any duration in any orientation. Oh, and it can occasionally whistle.- Everyone for all products needs to please stop putting bright LEDs on everything. Some of us try and sleep with these devices in the room, and we don't appreciate the point-source nightlight. Not that you could sleep with this fan due to the rattles.I like the design of Vornado products, but every single one I've ever had rattles, or has odd flaws that feel like manufacturing defects rather than design flaws. I feel like if they moved to a different manufacturer, they would be synonymous with air movement.So buy them for their unique innovation, but expect to return a few until you get one that was made properly.
Manually Corrected Review Content: Had we not discarded the packaging material inadvertently, this would have gone back for sure.On the plus side, it is good and moving air. The engineering is of the fan mechanism itself is clever.On the other hand:- The industrial engineering of this is such that it only works against a corner to the left while vertical, or to the right while horizontal. The purpose for the stage asymmetrical outer pice of plastic is a mystery to me both practically and aesthetically.- The rattles are really bad. The video I posted does not even do it justice. It basically just rattles on any speed for any duration in any orientation. Oh, and it can occasionally whistle.- Everyone for all products needs to please stop putting bright LEDs on everything. Some of us try and sleep with these devices in the room, and we don't appreciate the point-source nightlight. Not that you could sleep with this fan due to the rattles.I like the design of Vornado products, but every single one I've ever had rattles, or has odd flaws that feel like manufacturing defects rather than design flaws. I feel like if they moved to a different manufacturer, they would be synonymous with air movement.So buy them for their unique innovation, but expect to return a few until you get one that was made properly.

Title: Quiet but powerful device!
Review Content: This Vornado Fan helped transform my room from a hot, closed off feeling to a much breezier cool place! I didn’t think I could feel cool in my bedroom. Our AC doesn’t cool my room as much as the other rooms. We could never find a solution to cooling off this bedroom, until the Vornado. It’s a perfect size for an average sized bedroom, and it takes the warm air and then transforms it into a nice cool breeze. Very much recommend for those looking to cool off rooms that just don’t get the AC it needs.

Title: Could have been the greatest small fan ever
Review Content: Something in the case design eventually causes the entire fan to make a loud and annoying vibrating noise in both positions and at all speeds. It was perfect around the first year (like 5 star) however it started to develop the noise and gradually got worse. The noise would stop if I tightly grasp the frame with my hand but that is an untenable solution. Tightening the frame screws also did not help.Without the case noise, it does push a lot of air and is actually fairly quiet at the lowest setting. The versatility of having it lay horizontal or stand vertically is fantastic for use in different spaces. If you can get over the eventual loud rattling it develops, this fan is probably for you. It would probably be great in an already loud space.Ideally I would like to see some kind of revised version of the fan that fixes this eventual development of the rattling frame. I would totally buy that.

Title: dumb design
Review Content: I bought the Vornado because they have the best reputation for pushing air. It pushes air extremely well.I've had two problems with this fan. The first is, the silly "twist" design makes it less useful in various positions and orientations. It's a pity that bored industrial designers cause so much grief in the world.The other, much dumber problem, is the electronic controls. If one hooks up this fan to any kind of switch, then turning off the switch will turn off the fan (good!), but the fan will still be dead when the switch is turned back on (bad!). A mechanical switch would have made this fan cheaper to manufacture, last longer, and be more useful.Good fan. Lousy design.

Title: Moves A Ton Of Air. Not Very Durable
Review Content: I bought one of these fans last summer. It pushes some serious air. I'd run it about an hour or two a day. But, after about a month it began making a rattling vibration type of sound. I figured it was just a one off issue and I got a bad one.This summer I bought 3 more. Again, it moves some serious air and out of the box they are whisper quiet. But like clockwork, after about a month they are louder than the oscillating fan granny had back in the 80's.I used a screw driver to open it up and clean it and I added some dry graphite lubricant on all moving parts. That worked for about a day.Like I said, moves a ton of air. But truthfully, the fact that you only get about a month before the noise sets in, it isn't really worth the money in the long run. All 4 of the fans do it now. The sound of the moving air isn't what I'm referring to. It's the fan parts itself making the noise.

Title: issues
Review Content: I ordered two for two small rooms. Only used one and heard the motor fluctuating in speed no matter the speed setting. Sounded like it was loosing power and then returned to normal. Also the highest setting is very loud. This is not a fan, it's a blower. Blowers suck in air from a large entry and then force them out into a small exit. That's why this blower makes noise like a vacuum when you have it on High. The only silent speed is 1-2 which are effectly not blowing enough air for it to be a room fan but enough minimal air to hit your face if you've got it right in front of you at the desk. The image depicted on how the airflow comes out is also misleading. The airflow area is much much much more narrower than I imagined.

Title: Could use more angles.
Review Content: Where most devices with this "tube and holster" design let you swivel things almost 360 degrees, it was a disappointment to find that you get barely 45 degrees of motion, meaning that you shouldn't be surprised if you need to float another little tchotchke under it from around the house in order to get the angle you wanted. However, we haven't had any of the durability or noise problems others complained about. The mode-cycling power button is sleek, simple, and gives a little dash of modernity to what would otherwise be a very plain fan, and while it doesn't shoot a very wide cone of air, what it blows is very strong - once the fan was well-targeted, I was getting chilly in the middle of summer. That's what we're looking for here!

Title: 4 settings, Top 2 will blow your... eardrums?
Review Content: It's a great fan, I can point it at my bed at night just as easily as I can turn it around to blow at my desk halfway across the room. The issue I have is that settings 4 and 3 make this terrible rattling noise. If I'm doing something, I can tune it out easily enough, but it's difficult at night, so I usually keep it on a lower setting. I'll admit that this isn't much of a problem for me, because setting 2 is plenty strong enough if it's next to you (mine is on my nightstand). But I would like to be able to leave it turned up if I wanted to without it making that rattling, shuddering, whirring noise.
Manually Corrected Title: 4 settings, Top 2 will blow your... eardrums?

Title: Well...it looks nice.
Review Content: Brent recently closed escrow on a palatial town house in west new york new jersey complete with central air and so of course I did my best to provide my children with a place they'd want to be with the purchase of a very fancy looking fan. Thing looks like it belongs in a doctors office and like the doctor I haven't seen one I liked in a while. This "air circulator" is no fan, a slight breeze can be felt at top power and the rest of the settings are as useless as my pleads for sanity in family court. My room, my apartment, my home, is as small as they come and all it does is push the popcorn smell out and let the rendering plant odor in.

Title: Worth it.
Review Content: In 115 degree+ temps, in a small room, with 35-50% humidity, this is quite nice! I very much enjoyed the Vornado fan. A little higher on the white noise sound, but definitely worth the price! I am telling everyone about it. Helped me sleep a bit more comfortably!

Title: Very functional
Review Content: At the lowest speed, you can't hear the noise and it cools quite well.
Manually Corrected Review Content: At the lowest speed, you can't hear the noise and it cools quite well.

Title: Does the job!
Review Content: This fan is perfect  for my bedroom and easy to use. It fits in a corner and you have four levels to set it at. It doesn't rotate but it moves the air and helps keep my upstairs cool so I don't have to crank up the a/c to cool it down. I'm happy with the cost, fan power, and the small size yet effective.

Title: Little loud
Review Content: Gets the job done, but it's a little loud at top speed and vibration is bad when vertical..
Manually Corrected Review Content: Gets the job done, but it's a little loud at top speed and vibration is bad when vertical..

Title: High pitched squeal!
Review Content: Although I like this Vornado, on the top speed there is a high whistle. I mostly wanted it for white noise at night and keep it on its highest setting. The noise level is quite disappointing. The high whistle is actually unpleasant to my ears, and at lower speed it doesn't whistle but it doesn't create white noise either.
